58283.description:
"Kivalasztottak, the Magus Kartya" (English translation: "The Chosen Ones, the Wizard Cardgame"), is a strategic collectible card game based on the Hungarian role playing game M.A.G.U.S. In the game, players are magicians who try to destroy the towers of the other magicians or to collect 19 victory points.

The game has been around for more than 10 years, and could be considered Hungary's answer to Magic the Gathering. Various sets for the game exist, including Árnyékháború, Krán Törvénye, Hétarcú Birodalom, Zászlóháború, and many others.

Most sets consist of either 54 cards (18 common, 18 uncommon, 18 rare), or 108 cards (36 common, 36 uncommon, 36 rare). Booster packs usually contain 12 cards, with distribution as follows: 7 common, 4 uncommon, 1 rare. Some preconstructed decks have also been released.
58283.name: Kiválasztottak, a M.A.G.U.S. kártyajáték
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ29: El pare, el campió, els hongaresos i el somriure

58284.name: Der Bund der schwarzen Schlange
58284.description:
Translated from the back:
The long and dangerous journey through the southern seas is coming to an end. Finally the heroes will have a chance to confront their real opponents and to get even with them ...

58285.name: Liebliche Prinzessin Yasmina
58285.description:
Translated from the back:
It seems to be the special fate of beautiful princesses to be abducted from time to time. On the other hand such a sad destiny inevitable calls upon a courageous rescuer, which is you dear friend one of the last true heroes...
Prepare yourself - not only with courage and your favourite sword but with humour as well! Else you will hardly stick out this adventure!

58286.name: Im Zeichen der Kröte
58286.description:
Translated from the back:
There are good witches in Aventurien and bad ones - horrible creatures filled with lust for power. This adventure is about a meeting with one of the black circles about a meeting that your adventurers will not soon forget.

58287.name: Gaukelspiel
58287.description:
Translated from the back:
One would not consider it possible but Count Rabenmund ('Die Verschwörung von Gareth') strikes again! The only question that remains is if his new conspiracy will be foiled by his old enemies (your heroes). In any case our heroes have a couple of dangerous days ahead because this time Rabenmund is forewarned.

58288.name: Inseln im Nebel
58288.description:
Translated from the back:
Two of the best mariners of Aventurien embarked on an epic race. In this campaign which stretches over 4 modules our heroes at the side of captain Phileasson Foggwulf circle all of the known world. In doing so they have been confronted by many challenges some of them seeming unsolvable and almost all seeming deadly. In the fourth and final chapter of the tetralogy the heroes explore a far away island realm inhabited by strange elven folks before they return to Thorwal where a terrific final begins.

58289.name: Adventure Gaming (Issue 10 - 1982)
rpgissuearticle: So You Wanna Play Cowboys and Indians?
The Adventures of Space Trader Vic
The Big Horn Basin Range Wars
The Republic of Texas and the Mexican Empire Go To War!
58289.description:
Cover: A Dash for the Timber, a detail of an oil painting by Frederic Remington.

User commentary:

The self-proclaimed "back-from-the-grave" issue, this and subsequent issues only listed the volume and issue number and the year -- no month was given.

This was an American West themed issue.

58292.name: The Five
58292.description:
From the publisher's website:

Imagine The Warriors meets Grand Theft Auto armed with Double Dragon kung fu action and played to the beats of the Wu-Tang Clan!

In The Five you play a crew of soldiers slanging, banging and battling their way across the gang-ridden streets of The Five.

Feel the heat of the street with rapid-fire game play using dominoes, a NYC subway map and a slammin’ East Coast Hip Hop soundtrack.

The Five is a role playing game designed for Jared Sorenson’s game design challenge.

58293.name: TagMap
58293.description: TagMap is an interactive map for the Tagmar 2 game, it has all the important locations with some info for each. There is no credit given for the map, only the name of the software designer.

58294.name: GURPS Thaumatology: Alchemical Baroque
58294.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to a land that's as familiar as history and as fanciful as a fairy tale. GURPS Thaumatology: Alchemical Baroque presents the Known Lands, a place existing between the old history of magical tales and the new realities of exploration and enlightenment. It's a time of ghosts and giants, of spirits and spellcraft, of charm-slinging cunning-men and chubby sly cats. Yet even in these new times, the world needs heroes: haunted moors need exploring, wars need thwarting, and the fairies always need something – even if they refuse to reveal it.

Containing material originally appearing in GURPS All-Star Jam 2004, this supplement has been expanded and completely revised to GURPS (4th Edition) standards. It contains the history and character-creation information needed to adventure in this strange-but-familiar place. Taking advantage of the tools and techniques in GURPS Thaumatology to bring this world fully to life, GURPS Thaumatology: Alchemical Baroque contains information on alchemy and ritual magic in the Known Lands. It also offers stats for fairies, ogres, and sapient cats, plus information on ghosts, devils, and other threats. Take up your musket and quaff a brew of courage; fortune favors the bold!

58295.name: The First Day of School
58295.description:
The game players are student teachers or first year teachers who are preparing their own classrooms for the first time.

Object of the game is to be the first teacher completely prepared for the first day of school. Players must overcome a variety of unexpected events commonly experienced by new teachers during the month preceding that all important day.

Contents:

Game board
4 playing pieces
1 spinner
1 stack of Unexpected Events cards
1 stack of Other Dilemmas cards
1 stack of Teachers' Stores cards
1 stack of Campus Connections cards
1 stack of Teachers' Lounge cards
1 stack of Your Classroom cards
1 stack of District Office cards
4 Date of Hire cards

58296.name: Flow
58296.description:
The game is designed for respiratory therapy students, associate degree level, who are learning the hemodynamics of cardiopulmonary physiology as applied to critical care.

The players will be able to identify normal and abnormal hemodynamic pressures and corresponding conditions. The pressures relate to four disease states: Adult Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS), pulmonary edema, pulmonary embolism (PE), and lung collapse. The player who answers most questions correctly and moves around the board fastest wins the game.

Contents:

Folding board
Q & A Cards
Consequence Cards
One Die
Drawing straws
4 game pieces

58297.name: Livro dos Arquétipos
58297.description:
(Translated from the book introduction)

There is always a first time at the life of an RPG player where he is considered a newbie. This is always pointed by the inexperience on the first sessions of a new RPG. Many players, even the experienced on other systems have some difficulty absorbing so many new rules for game use, and becomes stunned with the many options at character creation.

This books was created thinking about those situations. Dedicated to the new comers of the fascinating Tagmar world, that do not want (or don't wish) to lsoe a lot of time learning the character creation rules... a book to help you learn first to play, and latter to create new characters.

It has 24 Arcehtypes encompassing the 6 races and and the 6 basic professions, for both sexes. It is an excelent choice not only to learn the game, but latter on as the archetypes were created following the normal rules. With a good range of choices, the archetypes allow you to evolve them naturally.

Welcome to the fascinating world of Tagmar.

58298.name: 5150: The Negotiating Game
58298.description:
The game is designed for adults who would like to learn and practice negotiation skills and techniques.

Players are part of a team that is trying to get a product to market. Each player has a different role (CEO, Content Expert, Creative Director, Union Boss, etc.) with different, often conflicting, priorities. As they move through different phases -- conducting research, designing the product, creating a prototype, production, and marketing -- players have two minutes per phase to agree on a course of action. If they cannot reach a majority vote, everybody loses.

The name "5150" refers to the nature of negotiating, and is also a term used by California law enforcement as code for someone who is crazy.

Contents:

Game board
3 Situation Cards
9 Role Cards
15 Event Cards
Chips
1 Die
Timer

58299.description:
Diamond Mining -
Adamas (Greek)
Adamant, inflexible; used by Greek and Latin writers for a stone (as a diamond) of
impenetrable hardness.

Object of the game.
To produce a thriving Mining Company and collect cash and assets in the amount of $500,000 starting with just $30,000

Each player controls an area where their claims are placed in hopes of hitting an actual mine. From there they turn Raw diamonds into Cut Diamonds (via a processing plant), and sell the cut diamonds to the general public at a premium price (via a distributor), All the while trying to control and manipulate the world and national markets for both Raw and Cut Diamonds. Simple mechanic, a little luck and a lot of strategy, could make you the next Diamond tycoon!

Thanks goes to The Game Crafters for having an awesome Idea and business.


NOTE on 11-12-2009***




I have taken this off of The Game Crafter site as I feel the production quality for this game is just not where I want it to be. I am currently looking into another source for publishing. Wish me luck.
58299.name: Adamas

58300.name: Footprints in the Forest
58300.description:
The game is designed primarily for middle-school through high-school students, whose ages range from 12 to 18 years, who reside in San Diego County.

The object of the game is to demonstrate wise use of and respect for the Cleveland National Forest by obtaining as many environmental points as possible. Another object of the game is to visit as many of the six major points of interest as possible.

Contents:

game board
six colored playing pieces
six-sided die
one box of question cards
one box of event cards
environmental point tokens
pollution point tokens
six sets of colored point of interest tokens
instruction card

58302.name: Terras Selvagens
58302.description:
(Translated from the book introduction)
Welcome dear reader to the fantastic world of Tagmar. You have in your hands the second volume of our expanded setting, the book "Terras Selvagens" (Wild Lands). On the next pages we will ride across the vast lands of the South of Tagmar, their exotic locations, full of secrets, danger and many wonders.

Let's explore with details the main points on this intriguing region, with special attention to the inhabitable Geleiras; Blur, the Kingdom of the Dwarven; Lar, the Kingdom of the Elves; the mysterious Vitreas Steeps; the terrifying Mangues and a plethora of other magnificent locations that always attract brave adventurers em search for danger, wealth and enchant.

58303.name: Follow the Drinking Gourd
58303.description:
This game is best suited for eighth grade students (age 12 and up) studying American history. It is designed for use in conjunction with lesson plans that cover African-American History around the time of the American Civil War.

Object of the game is to be the first player to arrive in Toronto, Canada (square 128) with $50.00

Contents:

Game board
Decision sheets
Question cards (60)
Event cards (20)
4 game pieces
Game money - $400.00 in denominations of $10.00, $20.00, $50.00.
1 die

58304.name: Found Walking: Liverpool
58304.description:
This game is designed to be played by those want to learn about the city of Liverpool.

The goal of the Found Walking: Liverpool game is to be the first player to
1. Visit at least 2 landmarks from each quadrant of the city (a total of 8 landmarks),
2. Purchase at least 6 souvenirs,
3. Visit the designated hotel at least once, and
4. Still have money left.

Contents:

Playing board
(6) Travelers
(6) Passports
(6) Itineraries
(6) Roadblocks
(6) Hotel vouchers
(162) Landmark vouchers
(36) Souvenir vouchers
(20) Chance cards
(20) Opportunity cards
£3000 Playing money

58305.name: Flush!
58305.description:
Flush! is designed for students ages 12 and up who are participating in San Diego wastewater treatment educational programs.

Object of the game is to be the first to move your pieces through the sewer line and treatment plant. Move through the sewer line by rolling a die. Move through the treatment plant by correctly answering questions about wastewater treatment.

Contents:

Game board
9 player pieces (3 pieces per player in 3 colors)
1 pyramid-shaped die (with roll values from 1 to 4)
Set of 18 Sewer Cards
Set of 18 Treatment Cards

58306.description:
The Glimmer of Hope!
For nearly four years, the fires of war have threatened to consume all the nations of mankind as the Word of Blake’s furious campaign of terror and deception raged on. Millions have died, mighty armies have fallen, and ancient empires have shattered, with no end in sight. But even as all hope seems lost, heroes old and new rise from the ashes of fire-blackened worlds to stand against the chaos and, maybe, to start turning the tide at last.

Jihad Hot Spots: 3072 continues the series begun with Dawn of the Jihad, bringing the readers into the ongoing chaos and horror of the Sphere-spanning war, as seen from the eyes of those who fight - and die - in this epic conflict. Players of both Classic BattleTech and the Classic BattleTech RPG will find additional rules and campaign tracks within to continue their campaigns across the Inner Sphere as the Blakist holy war rages on. Finally, Jihad Hot Spots: 3072 contains a mini-Technical Readout section - including record sheets - for several new units, including the six new celestial-series Word of Blake OmniMechs.
58306.name: Classic Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots – 3072

58307.name: Livro de Criaturas
rpgdesigner: Bruno José Ferreira de Souza Peixoto
58307.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

Big challenges for big heroes. What's best to gauge the ability of a character than the problems he faces? Any soldier of Ludgrin can defeat an Orco, but how many mortals have won a fight against an Imperial Dragon? Or a Necroarcono? How many adventurers can gloat about fighting the noble Giant Eagle? Or survive a meeting with the terrible Hydra?

This book has it all.

58308.description:
On October 25, 3068, the Word of Blake flooded the Inner Sphere HPG networks with "White Noise", a stream of gibberish and propaganda that made communications virtually impossible. Amid the noise, stunning secrets were revealed: Anastasius Focht was once Frederick Steiner; ComStar Primus Sharilar Mori was a Kurita spy.

Yet along with the secrets revealed and the spreading fires of the Jihad, the Blakists unveiled terrible new weapons and an army the size of which the intelligence agencies of the Inner Sphere had scarcely dreamed, spawning a darker, new wave of mysteries, and whispers of shadowy cabals. Hidden worlds, cults of assassins, ancient societies and even the mysteries of hyperspace - all emerged as possible sources for the Word of Blake's newfound power. Once more spanning all of human space from ancient Terra to the far-flung Clan homeworlds, the conspiracies behind the Jihad could be the key to unraveling the greatest war since the days of Amaris.

Jihad Conspiracies: Interstellar Players 2 describes several of the most powerful and influential people, organizations, and entities at work behind the scenes of the Word of Blake Jihad. Some of these conspiracies are firmly grounded in Classic BattleTech lore, but shown here in ways never before seen; others have only recently emerged from their own shadows. Gamemasters and players can decide which of these power brokers are real and which are paranoid fantasies spawned by the chaos and fear of the Blakist Holy War!
58308.name: Classic Battletech: Jihad Conspiracies – Interstellar Players 2

58309.name: Zahlen-Denkfix
58309.description: There are two spinners. One is spun to determine a result up to 20, the second one to determine how many number chips have to be used to get to that number. For instance, if the spinners show 16 and 3, you could use 7+5+4. The first player to place the correct chips (every player has different ones) on the table scores a point. The winner is the player with most points at the end.

58310.description:
Centuries-old Secrets Revealed!

Chandrasekhar Kurita has spent his life hunting for ancient secrets. Almost as soon as the Word of Blake formed in 3052, "Uncle Chandy" put his vast network of spies and his massive wealth toward digging behind their façade and now, two decades later, Uncle Chandy has discovered more than he ever thought possible. Now he’s using that knowledge to send a coalition of forces against one of the Blakists’ hidden five worlds: the Ruins of Gabriel. More importantly, he’s found a connection to the single greatest mystery in the last half-millennia. Aware he’s almost guaranteed his death at the hands of a Blakist fanatic, Uncle Chandy knows the time has come to stand in the light and reveal the secrets that will change the tide of the Jihad!

Jihad Secrets: The Blake Documents contains a wealth of information on the current universe-shaking Jihad storyline, providing more "hard facts" than any book to date. Detailed information on the opening years of the Jihad, including maps of the most significant conflicts; a current 3075 "Around the Sphere" in the same vein as the Jihad Hot Spots series provides up-to-date information on the latest happenings; biographies of more than twenty individuals important to the Jihad; a complete description of all Word of Blake forces, including unit logos; and the hidden history of Clan Wolverine and the Minnesota Tribe revealed! A complete rules section rounds the book out, with game play rules for taking any Word of Blake division into the field, construction rules for "primitive units," and new ’Mechs, including Clan Wolverine’s Mercury II, Pulverizer, and Stag, the "primitive" Dervish and the mysterious Raptor II.
58310.name: BattleTech Classic: Jihad Secrets – The Blake Documents

58311.description:
Rise of the Coalition!

Nine years since the death of the Second Star League, the Word of Blake’s holy war against all of humanity rages on. But new heroes, and new alliances have been forged between interstellar nations of the Inner Sphere and the Clans, setting aside centuries of distrust and hatred to unite as never before against the common enemy. Emerging from shattered realms, the allied coalition has finally found the strength to turn the tide, and now the Word and its allies are on the defensive. But even as the allies prepare for the inevitable finale, the Word’s unseen Master and his fanatical minions won’t fall without a fight!

Jihad Hot Spots: 3076 continues the Jihad plot book series started with Blake Ascending, bringing readers into the raging conflict of the war between the Word of Blake and the Inner Sphere. Seen from the eyes of those who fight and die in this epic struggle, this book includes articles and intelligence excerpts from across the Inner Sphere, along with additional rules and campaign tracks for both Classic BattleTech and Classic BattleTech RPG games, from the unwilling allies of the Blakist war machine, to the experimental technologies that gave the Word its incredible - if costly - edge for years, to several new BattleMechs, vehicles, and combat spacecraft that debuted in the midst of this turning point in the war.
58311.name: Classic Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots 3076

58312.description:
Cooperative game for children. Each player has two segments of an enchanted house with four cookies each. In the house there is a cute pussycat.
The players take turns rolling dice. When a cookie symbol is shown, the player may either remove a matching cookie from one of his or her wall segment, or donate the roll to another player. When a player rolls a cat symbol and has an incomplete cookie pattern, a puzzle piece is uncovered - when the tenth piece is opened, the cat turns into an evil cat and everyone loses. A player who rolls a cat symbol and has emptied one wall segment already, however, can cover up one puzzle piece. If all players manage to get all the cookies before the evil cat is summoned, everyone wins.
58312.name: Zauberkater

58313.name: Livro dos Objetos Mágicos
58313.description:
(Translated from the Book Intro)

Welcome noble reader to the fantastic world of Tagmar. You have in your hands the Livro dos Objetos Mágicos (The Book of Magical Objects). On its pages you will have access to the most powerful and intriguing magical artifacts of the Known World, and the rules that you - GM or player - can use to create your own enchanted devices.

This book was developed on an collective base, following the basic directives of the Tagmar 2 project, and it is divided in four parts:

Part 1: Special rules for magical items creation
Part 2: Prologue - Kerdal, the Paladin, is back trying to cross the dangerous Keiss Mountain Range
Part 3: Items descriptions
Part 4: Epilogue - The ending of Kerdal's Journey

58314.description:
Laura is traveling to China. Before a round, each player places one or more Laura tokens (depending on the number of players) on different locations on the game board. Each location consists of four puzzle pieces. Afterwards, players take turns flipping open puzzle pieces. When the piece shows a part of a location with a Laura token, the player can take place that piece and take the token. Also, he or she gets the star token.
Some puzzle pieces also depict a piece of the 9-piece star puzzle in the middle of the board. When such a piece is flipped open, it is placed on the star. When the star is complete, the game ends immediately and the player who currently holds the star token is the winner.
58314.name: Lauras große China-Reise

58315.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 154 - Aug 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Beyond the Book: New Rules & Variants for Hackmaster Basic
Disks of Wondrous Power: When Calculator Operations Manual Writers Make a Game
Gamemasters' Workshop: The Art of WaRPG's
Gamemasters' Workshop: The Good The Bad and the Ugly
Lookin' at Comics: Wizard World Chicago
Saving the World One Bager at a Time!
Web Scryer: Attack of the Retro Clones
58315.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #154
August 2009

The Boys are Back in Town

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

58316.name: Dawn of Legends
58316.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dawn of Legends is a new setting for the popular Savage Worlds license, bringing four-color super-heroic action to Pinnacle Entertainment's award winning role-playing game.

With a new, fully-customizable effects-based powers system designed to remain true to the fast, furious, fun of Savage Worlds, Dawn of Legends lets you don the cape and tights and battle crime wherever it is needed.

Inside the 283 pages are:

Over 40 new Edges, 20 new Hindrances, 6 Super-Team Edges, 5 Super-Team Hindrances.

More than 100 Powers, 30 Power Enhancements, 30 Power Drawbacks, 20 Power Boosters, and the complete rules for creating brand new powers using the exact formula used by the Designers.

Dawn of Legends also contains:


New uses for Bennies for comic book action
New Combat Maneuvers for four-color battles
Special mechanics for creating Super-Teams with their own "personality"
Popularity rules, governing a Hero's or Team's Public Image with the people and media
Over 90 NPCs ranging from Wildcards to Extras, Street Drugs, and Mystic Artifacts
A complete city with 10 Districts and over 80 Locations
Adventure Generator
Gamemastering tips for creating comic book Sagas


And more!

58317.description:
The game consists of an unusual game board which is actually a transparent screen with black color inside. By pushing the black color to the sides, one can see through.
At the start of the game, 20 symbol tiles are placed under the night sky. Everyone tries to remember their positions, then they are covered by the night. The players then draw task cards which show three of the symbols, then push the black color aside to display those three symbols shining in the night. When a mistake is made, a countdown starts (one of 20 cards is flipped over). When all 20 cards are flipped over before the players managed to fulfill 7 task cards, everyone loses. If not, everyone wins.
Several playing variants are given in the rule booklet, focusing on either opening right symbols or drawing pictures which others have to recognize.
58317.name: Laura und das chinesische Feuerwerk

58318.name: Dungeon (Issue 7 - Sep 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Tortles of the Purple Sage - Part 2
58318.description:
Volume II, No. 1

Cover by Paul Jaquays

Issue quote:
"A mile won't wait to be walked, and the road won't nap until my foot is upon it."
Broco the dwarf, Greyfax Grimwald, Niel Hancock

58319.name: Air-Rallye
58319.description: Up to four players start a top by blowing into a straw. The top then moves along a lane with obstacles which have to be passed by tilting the lane to move the top sideways, forward faster etc. The player whose top reaches a target point first is the winner.

58320.name: Guia do Colégio Alquímico
58320.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

The first big conquest in a wizards career is to be accepted by a School - that means that his feats are notable enough that these auspicious fraternities note him. In a way, to affiliate to a School confers status to a mystic, segregating him from the mass of mediocre or inexperienced sorcerers; advantages like a bigger spell list, and the renown conferred by the organization are at his disposal. But, in the end, what is a school? How's the relationship between the members? What are the rules of power?

For millenia, the Schools of magic hided their secrets in ancestral libraries, in obscure temples, in cryptic mysterious symbols. Their fountains of arcane knowledge, capable of open the gates of hell, to command the elements and nature or to trick the senses were previously inaccessible to the uninitiated... until today.

The gates of the Schools are finally open in this new edition of Tagmar so you can have access to the ancient secrets of these organizations.

58321.name: Guia do Colegio das Ilusões
58321.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

58323.name: Dungeon (Issue 9 - Jan 1988)
rpgissuearticle: The Golden Bowl of Ashu H'san
58323.description:
Volume II, No. 3

Cover by Valerie Valusek

Issue quote:
"Unless something goes terribly wrong we'll have you back about five minutes before you left, so there'll be time to spare and nobody'll ever need to know you were gone at all... And if something goes terribly wrong it won't matter whether we get back at all."
Mrs. Whatsit, A Wrinkle in Time, Madeline L'Engle

58324.name: Dungeon (Issue 17 - May 1989)
58324.description:
Volume III, No. 5

Cover by Carol Heyer

Issue quote:
"Avoid pride, illustrious hero. For a little while you will be at the peak of your strength; but it will not be long before sickness or the sword, or the hand of fire, or the raging sea, a thrust of the knife, a whizzing arrow, or hideous dotage, or failure and darkening of the eyes, will plunder you of your might."
--King Hrothgar, to Beowulf, Beowulf, translated by David Wright.

58325.name: Guia do Colegio Elemental
58325.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

58327.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

The gates of the Schools are finally open in this new edition of Tagmar so you can have access to the ancient secrets of these organizations.

58328.name: Bau mit
58328.description: Advertising game for a German bank. Players are trying to finance building their house. They move along a track, with the movement determined by their action cards. There are different types of action cards, not all of which can be played at all times. Event cards help or obstruct the players. The first player to reach the house without event cards and with no more than two action cards in his or her hand is the winner.

58329.name: Langfinger
58329.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The night is setting in slowly on the city, but not all of its inhabitants are asleep. Under cover of darkness, several scoundrels are on their way to perform their big heist tonight
You are playing the role of one of these scoundrels on the hunt for gold and art treasures. Careful planning will let you make the big haul, but be sure not to miss the right moment to cash in your swag at a fence!

Rules summary:

The players place their Scoundrel tokens at five locations on the central board, which are then resolved in the following order:

1 - City: Receive Tool cards required for the break-ins
2 - Villa: Receive Loot cards if you meet the tool requirements
3 - Ruin: Swap Tool cards from your hand with the draw pile.
4 - Museum: Receive Loot cards if you meet the tool requirements
5 - Harbor: Sell loot to the fence to gain gold (victory points)

The first player to earn 20+ gold wins.

The game is announced for release at Essen Spiel 2009.

Online Play


Yucata (turn-based)

58330.name: Módulo Básico
58330.description:
(Translate from the book Introduction)

Been one of the biggest systems in the Brazilian RPG scene, it only made sense to translate Tagmar for the Daemon System. This Core rules, both published at the website and latter released as a book marks an effort to get more people to know the amazing world of Tagmar.

58331.name: Construct Companion
rpghonor: 2004 ENnie for Best Non-d20 Supplement - Runners Up
58331.description:
From the publisher:

Bring out the mad scientist in your character with our Construct Companion. Whether you're looking for dependable mechanical mount or henchgolem to carry your loot, or something a little larger to batter down a castle wall, the Construct Companion has you covered. The companion is the complete guide to creating artificial entities of all kinds—so start equipping your lab today!

58332.name: Hundedämmerung
58332.description:
Publisher's description:

Subtitle: Twilight of the Dogs

Publisher's description:

Hundedämmerung is something different in the world of role-playing games. Most games allow players to portray beings of greater than human power wielding forces that ordinary people barely understand. This game allows you to play... a dog. Not just any dog, but a dog that has been lifted to human levels of intelligence, albeit the lower end of the scale, and endowed with minor telepathic powers that serve as speech.

In this game you will fight for the survival of your pack or the safety of "your" humans. And always, in the background, there looms the specter of a cat that is many cats - the undead, the undying, the (probably) evil Ozymandias.

In Hundedämmerung you have no spells, you wield no magical or high-tech weapons and your psionic abilities aren’t much good for combat. What you have are your wits backed by natural canine ability. Use them right and evil will be your chew toy. Mess up and Ozymandias will use you as a scratching post. Welcome to the doghouse, sucker.

58333.name: Mythic
58333.description:
Publisher's description:

Mythic is slightly different from other role-playing games in that the focus of the game is on the play, not the creation, of heroes. Mythic is, as its name suggests, based heavily on the sorts of heroes found in, well, myths. Gilgamesh, Achilles, Odysseus, Heracles, Beowulf, Siegfried, Arthur; the characters you create in Mythic may not be as famous as these, but their deeds will be no less heroic.

Though set in a fantasy world, Mythic strives to maintain a fair level of historical accuracy. Also, Mythic is set up to conduct play beyond the simple level of hack n slash dungeon delving often expected from fantasy rpgs. Characters are expected to be part of the game world, not some nameless killing machine.

58334.name: Gotham City Sourcebook
58334.description:
From the publisher:

The Gotham City Sourcebook provides detailed information on the people, places, and organizations of the Dark Knight's favorite city, as well as personal information and character statistics on Batman, Robin, Nightwing, Oracle, Azrael, and other characters of Batman's world. A supplement for the DC Universe Roleplaying Game.

58335.name: JSA Sourcebook (2001)
58335.description:
From the publisher:

The JSA Sourcebook covers three generations of super-hero teams -- the original Justice Society of America, Infinity Inc., and the new JSA -- along with their allies, enemies, and equipment. Inside, you will find:

A history of each team, spanning over six decades. Descriptions of members of several super-hero teams, including: Justice Society of America; All-Star Squadron; Freedom Fighters; Seven Soldiers of Victory; Young All-Stars; Infinity Inc.; The new JSA. A look at some of their greatest villains. A tour of each team's base and an overview of their equipment. A Narrator's section on the 1940s. A new adventure set during World War II that has the heroes searching for items from the time of Camelot. A great resource for the JSA and Golden Age comics!

58336.name: JLA Sourcebook (2000)
58336.description:
From the publisher:

This supplement includes detailed information on the current roster of the JLA and the JLA Watchtower. It also contains facts on the founding members of the JLA, the members of Young Justice, the bases of these two teams, and the adversaries of these incarnations of the JLA. A supplement for the DC Universe Roleplaying Game.

58337.name: The Department of Extranormal Operations Agent Manual
58337.description:
From the publisher:

Get the details on the top personnel of the Department of Extranormal Operations, the resources available to agents in the field, and their main headquarters. The supplement for the DC Universe Roleplaying Game also contains a metahuman file section (where players can record their own character information) and other useful materials.

58338.name: Magic Handbook
58338.description:
From the publisher:

Delve into the mystical and arcane aspects of the DC Universe with the Magic Handbook. This supplement expands upon the magical powers defined in the DC Universe Roleplaying Game rulebook. It also includes information on magical item creation,magical beings,magical places,and various magical items.

58339.name: Amos Daragon
58339.description:
Original description on the box:
L'équilibre du monde est menacé, les forces du bien et du mal se confrontent...

Devenez un Porteur de masques et partez à la recherche des masques et des pierres de puissance dispersés dans l'univers d'Amos Daragon! Vous aurez à combattre des dragons, des sorciers, des démons et des créatures fantastiques! Mais des êtres bons et courageux vous aideront dans votre aventure.

Un jeu original oû la rivalité et l'entraide se confondent pour vous faire vivre des moments de plus palpitants!

Translation:

As the balance of the world is threatened, the forces of good and evil confront...

Become a Mask Carrier and search for masks and rocks of power scattered throughout the world of Amos Daragon! You must fight dragons, wizards, demons and creatures of fantasy! But good and courageous people will help you in your adventure.

An original game of competition and cooperation that lets you live the most exciting moments!

58340.name: Adventure Gaming (Issue 11 - 1982)
rpgissuearticle: A Supplemental Guide to The Universe
Call of Cthulhu - Ghastly Gothic Horror
Mix and Match Battles with SPI's Prestags Series
The Adventures of Space Trader Vic
58340.description:
Cover: An interpretation of The Horror on Old Hill by Steve Liss

User summary:

For this issue the whole production department changed except for Tim Kask. Again, no month given for the publication date. Although the Space Trader Vic comic is labeled #6, it is actually #8 and was printed out of sequence.

58341.name: Dragon (Issue 86 - Jun 1984)
rpgissuearticle: Dragons and their deities: The lowdown on how and why they worship
The Ecology of the Slithering Tracker
Familiars with a special use: New 'pets' that match the magic-users who call them
Five new enchanted objects: Magic items you won't find in the AD&D books
Game review - Phantasy Conclave: Only phair
Know Your Enemy! A guide to supervillain groups
Presenting the Suel Pantheon: Adding to background for Greyhawk campaigns
The warrior alternative: Generating non-magical characters for the DQ game
58341.description:
Vol. IX No. 1 of Dragon Magazine. (Vol. VIII No. 12 was skipped)

Cover Art by Denis Beauvais.

This issue featured Great Stoney - All the parts you need to make a miniature cardboard castle and the ARES Section - 16-page spotlight on SF Gaming.
It also listed the "Gamers' Guide", which was an index of all the advertising in the issue.

58342.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 36 - Sep 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Babylon 5 2nd Edition Conversion Guide, Part I
Choosing Skills Based On Character Background
Were-Insects: A New Look At Lycanthropy
58342.description:
In this issue:


Steampunk Scoundrels


Mr I.N. Absentia Joshua Cole provides a suitably nasty villain to torment, manipulate and generally cause bother for your OGL Steampunk party. Will you succumb to his machinations or struggle against his indomitable will?


Were-Insects - A New Look At Lycanthropy


Not every were-creature needs to be covered in fur and bark a lot. We bring you such diverse beasties as the were-spider and the were-dung beetle. Can you bear to even look?


Babylon 5 2nd Edition Conversion Guide, part 1


Mongoose staff writer Bryan Steele begins a look at the differences between first and second edition Babylon 5. In this first part he is looking at the B5 races and what changes have been made.


RuneQuest Variant Weapon Tables


Mongoose head honcho, Matthew Sprange, designer of the versatile new RuneQuest game provides a set of weapons tables allowing you to redirect your games towards either high fantasy or lethal extreme!


Codename: Armoured Fury, part 1


Richard Ford begins a thrilling short story about the Mobile Infantry in this Starship Troopers fiction piece. Join Thrower’s Tigers on their mission to Xenon IV.


Choosing Skills Based On Character Background


Not all characters in a fantasy game have always trained to be ‘adventurers.’ In fact, most grew up performing other tasks or learned some things from their parents’ careers before they embarked on an ‘adventure.’ So says Joe Wetzel and he’s come up with some ways to make your characters a bit more rounded.


The Mad Druid


A truly epic adventure to herald the arrival of the brilliant new RuneQuest RPG sees the players thrust into the world of, well, druids actually. Set out on a setting-independent rural investigation and try and uncover why ancient rites are being flaunted by a farming community.

58343.name: Adventure Gaming (Issue 12 - 1982)
rpgissuearticle: A Supplemental Guide to the Universe
Legendary Powers of Metals, Gems and Woods
The Academy Replies to John Prados
The Adventures of Space Trader Vic
The Adventures of Space Trader Vic
58343.description:
Cover: An interpretation of Grimm of the Gameboard World done by Dean Morrissey

User summary:

No month given for publication date. The article from The Academy was left out of the table of contents. Because of the erroneous printing of Space Trader Vic #8 in the last issue, both #7 and #8 were printed in this issue.

58344.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 32 - Apr 2006)
rpg: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes
58344.description:
In this issue:


Born of Madness - The Paressi


An extensive article detailing one of the evil Drune tribes that inhabit the Sourlands of Tir Nan Og. Addicted to the hallucinogenic ergot fungus, the Paressi have gradually become insane over the generations...


The Ranger Renegades


The first of a three part article detailing the Legend of the Rangers TV movie, this article takes a studied look at the chaotic collection of personalities that make up the crew of the Liandra for the Babylon 5 Roleplaying Game. Meet the latest maverick captain and his bold crew, as well as the 2265 incarnation of G’Kar...


Masters of the Macabre


A collection of malevolent prestige classes for your fantasy games. There are those whose quest for power has led them down the darkest of dark paths, and those who were once men have become monsters... meet the Archfiend, the Deathlord, the Head Collector and the Spirit Chaser...


Aghraphur


The Great Keeper of Conan Lore (Vincent Darlage, to use his mortal name) turns his eye towards the many-towered glittering capital of Turan. This detailed article provides you with all the information you’ll ever need about this magnificient city...


Boompowder, Treason and Plot


Following a successful mission hunting down bandits in Ruanon, the Heroes of Magnamund are asked by a humble merchant for aid. If you feel that your band of Heroes are able to come to the assistance of the merchant, turn to page 58. If you want to decline the merchant’s offer and instead learn more about some of the warriors of Magnamund, wait one month and turn to Signs & Portents Roleplayer issue 33.

58345.name: Adventure Gaming (Issue 13 - 1982)
rpgissuearticle: A Retailer Replies to John Prados
A Supplemental Guide to the Universe
Feudal – Revamping a Family Game into the Wargame It Should Be
Illuminati – Paranoia Runs Rampant at the Gaming Table
Legendary Powers of Metals, Gems and Woods
Modules: Are They Hurting Your Game?
Spell Law – A More Ordered Approach to FRP Magic
The Adventures of Space Trader Vic
58345.description:
Cover: David Martin, by permission of SJ Games

User summary:

No indications that this would be the last issue.

58346.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 29 - Dec 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Dark Places of the World: Xuthal
Everybody Wants to Rule the World
The Fear Files: The Bearer of Wasps
58346.description:
In this issue:


Enter the mysterious green-stoned city from R.E Howard's 'The Slithering Shadow' in the Conan RPG or try some action-based prestige classes for the Babylon 5 RPG. For fantasy D20 fans, there is Scripture Magic, allowing you to harness primal supernatural forces through the power of the written word. The Bearer of Wasps provides alien entities for OGL Horror, while the Judge Dredd RPG gains a new terrorist organisation in the shape of the Sons of Kraken. Between Hammer and Anvil is a complete scenario for the Babylon 5 RPG. Plus, all your regular columns are featured!

58347.name: Dungeon (Issue 23 - May 1990)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Tips on Home-Grown Modules.
58347.description:
Volume IV, No. 5

Cover by Carol Heyer

Issue quote:
"Who can know why the Cosmic Balance exists, why Fate exists and the Lords of the Higher Worlds, why there must always be a champion to fight such battles?"
--Sepiriz, to Elric, Stormbringer, Michael Moorcock

58348.name: Dungeon (Issue 24 - Jul 1990)
58348.description:
Volume IV, No. 6

Cover by Paul Jaquays

Issue quote:
"With a host of furious fancies
Whereof I am commander,
With a burning spear and a horse of air,
To the wilderness I wander.
By a knight of ghosts and shadows
I am summoned to a tourney
Ten leagues beyond the wild world's end.
Methinks it is no journey."
--Tom O'Bedlam, Anonymous

58349.name: Dungeon (Issue 28 - Mar 1991)
58349.description:
Volume V, No. 4

Cover by Paul Jaquays

Issue quote:
"And a strange music went with him,
Loud and yet strangely fair,
The wild pipes of the western land,
Too keen for the ear to understand,
Sang high and deathly on each hand,
When the dead man went to war.
--The Ballad of the White Horse, G.K.Chesterton

58350.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 27 - Oct 2005)
rpgissuearticle: A Field Guide to the Creatures of the Hyborian Age
58350.description:
In this issue:


Port Bax Part


One A complete campaign setting for the Lone Wolf RPG.


B52E


Gareth Hanrahan reveals some of the secrets of the 2nd Edition of the Babylon 5 RPG.


Inside the Chainmail Bra


Fey Boss takes a look at what is required to keep a player's attention.


Gaming Symposium


This month reviews the role of ancient threats and elder races in campaigns. First part of a series.


A Field Guide to Creatures of the Hyborian Age


A detailed study of Man-Apes, an ever present menace in the Conan RPG.


Emergency Situation!


A range of ready to go missions for the Starship Troopers RPG - spend 5 minutes reading and you can begin your campaign tonight!


The Jonny Nexus Experience


We can't stop him - Jonny brings his own very special version of gaming to a wider audience.


Suffer the Little Children


Characters of a new generation for the Jeremiah RPG.


Ghost of the Deep


A Pirate Isles adventure for the Conan RPG.

58351.name: Dragon (Issue 295 - May 2002)
58351.description:
Dragon Magazine
Issue 295
Vol. XXVII No. 12
May 2002

Castles

Cover art by Todd Lockwood

58352.name: Murmel Spass
58352.description: Miniature golf game to be set up on a table, on the floor or wherever; with marbles, tiny golf clubs and lots of obstacles. The players can set up the obstacles any way they like, then add flags to determine the order in which they have to be played. The player who needs least hits to get his or her marble into the last hole is the winner.

58354.name: Buchstaben-Denkfix
58354.description: There are two spinners, one determines a color, one a number. The players have letter tiles and try to assemble words with the number of letters determined by the number spinner, starting with a letter tile of the color determined by the color spinner. The first player to manage that gets a chip.

58355.name: Advanced Dungeons and Savages
58355.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Complete Handbook for playing AD&D-style games in Savage Worlds!

Players Section includes races, classes, equipment, and descriptions of over 75 spells. Dungeon Masters Section includes NPC classes, rules for converting monsters, encounter charts for 13 types of terrain, random determination charts and descriptions for over 200 magic items, and complete rules on magic item creation.

This Item is FREE.

58356.name: Calendero
58356.description: There are 48 cards, representing 12 months with 4 weeks each. These are randomly laid out (face-down) in a 12x4 "calendar" grid. The players take turns to flip open a card and place it in the correct position for the card on the calendar. They also pick up the card that was in that position before, look at it and place it (face-down) in the position they first picked up a card from. A player who places the fourth card in any month gets to keep all four cards from that month. The player with most months is the winner.

58357.name: Dragon (Issue 87 - Jul 1984)
rpgissuearticle: Beyond the Dungeon: How to cope with the greatest adventure of all
The Ecology of the Dryad - Lesson of the day: Don't catch them, they'll catch you
A Field Guide to Lunar Mutants
The Legacy of Hortus: Fifteen of the master's most fruitful experiments
WHITEOUT: A TOP SECRET game adventure
rpg: Universe: The Role-Playing Game of the Future (1st & 2nd Editions)
58357.description:
Vol. IX No. 2 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Jack Crane.

This issue featured Whiteout - Adventuring in Antarctica for TOP SECRET agents and the ARES Section - 16-page spotlight on SF Gaming.
It also listed the "Gamers' Guide", which was an index of all the advertising in the issue.

58360.name: Hearts in Glorantha (Issue 3 - Summer 2009)
rpgissuearticle: How to do Magic: Casting a Spell
The Dragonsnail - A Part of the Devil
The Tomb of the Empty Emperor
We All Live in a Brass Submarine
58360.description:
Contents

The Poisonthorn Forest by Shannon Appelcline
Within The Poisonthorn by Shannon Appelcline
Iron by Jane Williams
We All Live In A Brass Submarine by Richard Crawley
The Monsters Of Magasta by Nick Davison
Wonderous Statues by John Harding
Chaos Feature Competition Top 10 compiled by Matthew Cole
Three Legs Of Vice by Stewart Stansfield
The Dragonsnail: Part Of The Devil by John Harding
Uphold The Yellow Standard!! by Newt Newport
The Tomb Of The Empty Emperor by Newt Newport
How To Do Magic: Casting A Spell by Greg Stafford

58361.name: Die Tränen der Götter
58361.description:
2 knights get called to the Marienburg in 1441. Here they receive the order to secretly inspect the land and to gather information about the balance of the power and the trade.

At this time amber is considered magical and is the most important source for wealth. The players travel to the coast of the Baltic Sea in search for amber. Exchanging amber for goods enables them to influence the councils of the surrounding cities. Shipping amber or contributing it towards castles in order to influence the religious faith can also lead to victory.

Each player controls a merchant pawn but can also act as a smuggler at the same time. And do not forget the offerings of the head of the amber's guild. His help can give you great profit. But beware the thugs although even they aren't invincible.

The game contains:
1 rulebook, 1 board, 1 start player pawn, 1 ship, 2 smuggler pawns, 4 cards "religious order", 30 goods, 24 amber chits, 35 amber "stones", 1 knight pawn, 16 cards "head of the amber's guild", 9 discs, 1 die, 1 bag, 4 merchant pawns, 4 player discs, 4*25 markers

58362.name: Manuale dell'investigatore
58362.description:
From the back of the book:
"Investigator fields manual
This book contains the Field Manual of the Theron Marks Society, a secret organization that from 1920 till 1925 fought the awful cthulhoid manifestations worldwide. This manual includes all the investigative techniques and the hints necessary to defeat cruelest horrors than conjure in the shadows: this is a real scripture that every occult investigator needs. Furthermore, in the inside you'll find an useful appendix that will help you solve all the frightening mystery
'Normal people don't spit you back bullets you shot!'
"This rare italian book collects "Field Manual of the Theron Marks Society" from Terror from the Stars , "The ten Commandments of Cthulhu Hunting" and "Sinister seeds" from Cthulhu Casebook.

58363.name: Geographically Speaking
58363.description:
The learners will be able to identify the location and capitols of each of the 48 contiguous states.

Object of the game is to capture the most states by placing your team's marker on the state.

There are 2 ways to capture a state:
1. Be the first team to name the state and its capitol.
2. Answer a bonus question correctly and name the state and its capitol.

Contents:

6-sided die
Gameboard
Hint Cards
Bonus Cards
Red, Blue, Yellow and White markers
Answer Key

58364.name: Entrapment
58364.description: Adventure description from front page "Old Wicked has set in motion a plot years in the making and two of the most powerful wizards on Oerth, once allies, seem to stand on different sides. You must choose between them; pray that you are correct. Part two of Ascension, the final core plot arc for the Living Greyhawk campaign. Part four and the conclusion of Idylls of Tysiln, a Sheldomar Valley plot arc. A two-round core adventure of investigation, danger, and wheels within wheels. An adventure for characters of Average Party Levels 8 through 16."

58366.name: GeoMultiPlex
58366.description:
There are cards with mathemathical operations and gameboard with numbers. Player play a card in his turn and look for answer from gameboard for his operation & place his token on this square.

The goal of the game is for a player to place four of his/her tokens on the game board so that the pieces form the corners of a square of any size (or triangle etc.).

58367.name: Das Traumschiff
58367.description: This game is based on the German TV series Das Traumschiff. Players roll dice to move around, trying to meet other players. When they do, they can ask them for specific cards; the other player can ask for other specific cards in return. The player with most pairs (or the first one to get three pairs from the same Traumschiff episode) is the winner.

58368.description:
Seven little goats hide in a house as the wolf is coming. As in the fairy tale, one of them hides in a clock (which is a frame for a sand timer), the others hide in other pieces of furniture (the beautiful material actually contains wooden little furniture with space to hide the goats.
The players take turns rolling dice. The wolf moves toward the furniture, the goat player moves the chairs to block the wolf's path. When a clock symbol is rolled, the sand timer is set in motion (wolf's roll) or suspended (goat player's roll). If the wolf manages to find all goats before the sand timer has run through twice, the wolf is the winner; if not, the goat player wins.
58368.name: Die sieben Geißlein

58369.description: This is a variant of Connect four (Vier gewinnt). The frame only has 5x3 fields. Each player has 5 chips. However, after inserting the fourth chip, one can chose to shift a row sideways, pushing out chips and causing others to drop down to fill the gap. The first player to get three in a row is the winner.
58369.name: Drei gewinnt

58370.name: Humanopoly: The Facts of Life Game
58370.description:
"Humanopoly is an educational and entertaining experience for the whole family. The game provides a unique, creative alternative to traditional methods of teaching children the facts of life."

The object of the game is to fertilize the egg. This fertilization occurs when the egg player catches (lands on the same square) a sperm player or when a sperm player catches the egg player.

Includes the board, 2 dice, 4 sperm tokens, 1 egg token, score chips, Fact cards, Question cards, Love cards, assembly diagram, storage insert, and rules with two levels of play for different age groups.

58371.description: U.B. Funkeys 3D Game is a children's roll and move game based on the Mattel video game. Player move through a 3D map of Funkeystown with the goal of being the first player to reach FINISH by exact count. Movement is determined by drawing numbered cards. The winner is the first player around the board.
58371.name: U.B. Funkeys 3D Game

58372.name: The Complete Canal Priests of Mars
58372.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Complete Canal Priests Of Mars

The orginal release of "Canal Priests of Mars" (Space 1889) cut about a THIRD of the manuscript, much to the chagrin of author Marcus L. Rowland (creator of Forgotten Futures ).

Now, finally, the complete campaign is ready to play~

"BASK! In the glory of London, hub of Empire!
TRAVEL! Aboard a luxurious ether liner!
MARVEL! At the wonders of Mars!

Our heroes help Martians accomplish a holy mission in London, then travel to Mars aboard the Princess Alexandra, the largest and most luxurious ether liner ever built! Throughout their journey they must face the hazards of London, the Ether, and Mars, compounded by mysterious enemies bent on stopping their Martian allies!"

58373.name: Legends of Middle Earth
58373.description:
Publisher's description:

Author's description:

Legends of Middle Earth is a role-playing game (or RPG) set in the world of The Hobbit, The Lord of the Rings, The Silmarillion, and other works of professor JRR Tolkien.

Because this document does not go into detail about Middle Earth, it is a good idea to have read the books (or at the very least seen the movies) before playing a game using this rule set.

Note that this is a completely unofficial work; the author is not affiliated with the Tolkien estate in any way, and the company Decipher puts out a legitimate Lord of the Rings Role-Playing Game. There is no charge for this game, ever.

58374.description:
The London Borough of Chelsea is famous for its expensive houses and top of the range cars, and is home to many rich people. The children of six of these Chelsea residents have reached adulthood and are looking to find partners and set up homes of their own. In order to help their children, their parents start buying houses, vans and cars. However, their children have strong colour preferences, and also like their houses and vehicles to be colour-coordinated.

Each of the three to six players takes the role of one family, and aims to be the first to set up all their children for their adult life. This will involve repainting houses, repainting garages, buying and exchanging vans and cars, until your children are happily installed in their new homes.

Chelsea is a simple, yet thought provoking game, which teaches children to plan a strategy and follow it through in order to succeed. Because it only has a small amount of luck, children are rewarded for good play, and thus encouraged to think about what they are doing. But most importantly, because Chelsea is a game which teaches, rather than a teaching aid disguised as a game, children will enjoy it, and play it again and again.

[Note] The emphasis on children as the target audience for this game does it a serious a dis-service & kills its appeal to a gamer. This is a fine light filler & suitable for adults to enjoy.[/Note]
58374.name: Chelsea

58375.name: Eine gegen Eine
58375.description:
Eine gegen Eine (One against One) is different. On the one hand it's a quite normal four player game but on the other it's an experience. There are well defined rules but no rule book around. The players get to learn the rules just by unpacking and playing. Forget reading rules and explaining. Just play.

As discovering is part of the game there is
- no information about the content.
- no information about the genre.
- no information about the rules.

Eine gegen Eine is a project by "Weilburger Sieben". During the fourth "Deutsche Spieleautorentagung" (German game designers congress) seven game designers did a workshop to try something new: a game that completely explains itself. Eine gegen Eine is the result of this attempt.

58376.name: Dragon (Issue 88 - Aug 1984)
rpgissuearticle: Beyond the Dungeon: Moving a campaign into the great outdoors
The Ecology of the Rust Monster
ICE can stand the heat: A long look at Iron Crown's 'Rolemaster' series
Physics and falling damage: Velocity's the key to understanding crash landings
58376.description:
Vol. IX No. 3 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by James Holloway.

This issue featured Elefant Hunt - The latest game from Tom Wham's imagination and the ARES Section - 16-page spotlight on SF Gaming.
It also listed the "Gamers' Guide", which was an index of all the advertising in the issue.

58377.name: Dragon (Issue 27 - Jul 1979)
rpgissuearticle: The Adventures of Finieous Fingers, Fred & Charly
Agincourt: The Destruction of French Chivalry
Go Boldly Where No Man Has Gone Before: Expanding IMPERIUM
Philmar's THE ENGLISH CIVIL WAR: Don't Let the Wretched Box Put You Off
The Mythos of Africa in DUNGEONS & DRAGONS
The Political and Military Effects of Agincourt on the Hundred Years War
The Voyages of Exploration Ship Znutar
58377.description:
Vol. IV No. 1 of Dragon Magazine, then called "The Dragon."

Cover Art by Thomas Canty.

Todd Oleck drew a few comics scattered throughout the issue.

This issue had an insert "GenCon update and schedule" listed as pages 1A-8A.

58378.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 28 - Nov 2005)
rpg: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes
58378.description:
In this issue:


Arcane Hybridisation


The ways of magick may be gradually giving way to the advance of technology in OGL Steampunk, but mythical creatures such as manticores and dragons are a terrifying reality. Just like the regular, animal hybrids, Science has found a way to combine these fearsome monsters with the human form...


Alternative Babylon 5 Campaigns


Darrin Drader returns to take another look at more alternative campaign styles for the Babylon 5 Roleplaying Game. Are your players ready to take on a two-fisted, all action campaign, fighting as part of a GROPOS unit on some distant planet?


New Angles on Adversaries


The second part to our epic Gaming Symposium investigating new types of antagonists to throw against your players takes a detailed look at the little folk - the gnomes and the halflings. Prepare to have your knees bashed in with Bob Griffin!


The Nisse


Return to the world of Sláine to encounter one of the inhabitants of Tir Nan Og - but beware, it can never truly die!


Port Bax


This massive examination of Lone Wolf’s Port Bax continues this month. Will you: Investigate Commoners’ Circle, rest for a while at the Port Inn, talk to the guard at the Red Gate or seek information at the Sommerlund Consulate? Make your decision on page 36!


20,000 Clones Under the Sea


The first Paranoia scenario to appear in the pages of Signs & Portents since, er, the last time we had one, this epic adventure is sure to tax the skills of any troubleshooter that dares to attempt the mission (WARNING: Failure to attempt the mission is treason). Now with added Outrageous Accents!

58379.name: Dungeon (Issue 96 - Jan 2003) / Polyhedron (Issue 155)
rpgissuearticle: You Can Lead a Horse to Water
58379.description:
Volume XVI Number 6

Cover by Marc Sasso
Polyhedron cover by John Van Fleet

The two issues are printed back-to-back; one side has a Dungeon front cover, and if you turn the magazine upside-down, you see a Polyhedron front cover.

Issue quote:
"Romeo.
Courage, man; the hurt cannot be much.

Mercutio.
No, ;tis not so deep as a well, nor so wide as a church door; but 'tis enough, 'twill serve: ask for me to-morrow, and you shall find me a grave man. I am peppered, I warrant, for this world -- A plague o' both your houses!"
--William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet, Act III, Scene i

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

58380.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 33 - May 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Tales from the Mongoose Open Day
58380.description:
In this issue:


Tales from the Mongoose Open Day


The Mongoose crew’s adventures a long time ago in a galaxy far far away returns next month, but this month we have a Special Report! At the last Mongoose Publishing Open Day, there was a unique session of the Babylon 5 Roleplaying Game - starring Claudia Christian herself! Now, you can hear the story of the episode that was never on TV - ‘The Attack of the Grey Wallet Things with Strings Attached’!


Palmyrion Knight of the Shield


Not strictly a Knight, but nevertheless a highly trained and honourable soldier, the Palmyrion Knight of the Shield forms part of one of the most respected and powerful armies in the realm of Magnamund. YOU have the chance to join their elite ranks in this article for the Lone Wolf Roleplaying Game!


The Weirdinators


Morgan Davie presents another of his Fear Files. This month, meet a team of students keen to battle the reals of the rum and uncanny - but are they really prepared for what they might find?


Nested Amalgamations


Everyone remembers those Russian dolls, each individual containing another, smaller doll. Warped minds have begun to apply this idea to monsters - when one creature falls, another, smaller creature rises from the remains to continue the battle... are your PCs ready to face the horror of the Trognohob?


Gaming Symposium


This month’s Gaming Symposium continues on our theme of presenting memorable campains. New writer Nadin Brzezinski offers a wide range of tips, including taking your inspiration from real world events and organisations.


Advanced Training


A whole collection of new advanced training options for the Starship Troopers Roleplaying Game. Your Mobile Infantry Trooper now has the chance to become a Bug Wrangler, a SICON Millitary Agent, A WASP Pack Trooper or a Rambler Mobile Scout! Do you want to know more? Turn to page 48!


Old Father Crime


A fantasy scenario this month. A group of adventurers are offered the apparently inncoent task of escorting a dying brother to a famous healing monestry - but is everything as it appears?

58381.description:
E2 (Experiment Expansion) is a small expansion for Experiment.

E2 provides the necessary cards to play Experiment with 7 players.

E2 also includes the rules for the 2 player version for Experiment (special thanks to Richard Warren).

E2 can perfectly be used together with the Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion (E4).
58381.name: Experiment Expansion

58382.description:
E3 (Extra Experiment Expansion) is a very small expansion for Experiment.

E3 introduces 3 new cards for the confidential lab cards deck, beakers with a combination of two secondary colours.

These wildcards can be used to replace one of each of the beakers with a secondary colour of the original game to add some more variation (and more power to the confidential lab cards).
58382.name: Extra Experiment Expansion

58385.name: Akashic Nodes: The Home of Memory
58385.description:
From the publisher:

If knowledge is power, then the collective memory of all who passed before must be powerful indeed. Akashic Nodes: The Home of Memory is the first in the AEvolutions line of sourcebooks from Blue Devil Games, providing exciting, original material for Monte Cook's Arcana Evolved.
Written by the Keepers of the Oath, a dedicated and talented enclave of AE scholars, this book explores the phenomenon of akashic nodes, locales where the concentration of memory is at its greatest. Each chapter presents a unique, fully-described node as a way of introducing new rules, including:

Citadel of the Wayhunters: A fallen sibeccai fort with detailed mechanics for expanding the concept of the node. Epicenters, aspects, lore, and echoes offer new ways to customize your nodes.

Academy of Visions: The ruins of a small community of akashics, magisters, and runethanes, this chapter explores the connection between nodes and magic, presenting new spells, runes, and magic items for characters and GMs alike.

The Forgotten Graveyard: A mysterious resting place marked by bones of every shape and size and home to many strange creatures from the vicious akashic reavers to the mysterious mind giants known as the merro.

The Burlboughs: A secluded area of the Harrowdeep, where the Green and the Dark wage a centuries-long battle for control. This chapter offers new rules for adapting nodes to aid characters of every class.

The Serpent's Heart Guildhall: An exhaustively described akashic guild with a dozen fully described NPCs and enough plot hooks to sustain an entire campaign.

"The Fading of All Things": A full-length adventure, in which the party races through the sands of the southern lands to undertake a node ritual and avert a war, all the while harried by a band of vallorians and their dreaded minions.

58386.name: Tell It To My Axe
58386.description:
From the publisher:

Order! Peace! Justice!
Since the time of Sir Redic Pynchar, the humans of Terrakal have strived for these ideals by any means necessary. In the years that followed, the Order of the Axe has proven to be a potent force for change in the lands of the Diamond Throne, as powerful as it is enigmatic. The knights of the order will do what they must to bring their vision of a free world to fruition. To any who would stand in their way, the reply is simple: “Tell it to my axe!”

Tell It To My Axe! is the third entry in the AEvolutions line of sourcebooks, providing exciting, original material for Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. It is scribed by the Keepers of the Oath, a dedicated and talented enclave of AE scholars, who brought you the critically acclaimed Akashic Nodes: The Home of Memory.

A heightened prestidigitation spell was required to fit so much information into the book’s 126 pages, which include: A full history of the Order and the Knights, a fully-fleshed out and mapped chapterhouse, a full-length adventure, 50 fully statted NPCs, 39 adventure seeds, 29 new feats, 10 rebellious spells, 8 knightly prestige classes, 4 new creatures and templates, 17 new magical and mundane items, and 16 rituals, rites, and ceremonies. Not just exhausting detail about the Order or tons of new crunch, chapters include advice and mechanics for introducing a system of honor, creating exciting mounted combat encounters, and running a rebellion-based campaign. In fact, Tell It To My Axe! contains 25% more material than Akashic Nodes at the same, low price.

When the time for rebellion is at hand, will you be ready?

58387.name: The Lost
58387.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Arcana Evolved Spell Treasury contains hundreds of spells just waiting to be introduced into an existing campaign. Obviously, one can just add the spells as "now available," but that doesn’t seem very heroic somehow. The purpose of this adventure is to illustrate some possible ways to bring the new spells into an existing campaign. It shows the spells, adventure ideas, and research methods from the book - well, as many as we could cram in - being used in a game setting. Not all spell effects are available for players to use. Some are there to provide variety and challenges to the players, while others are there to add atmosphere and flavor to the story being told. DMs can use the adventure as written or use it for its tips on how to put the resources in the Spell Treasury to good use.

This short adventure, "The Lost," is a free web enhancement by Jeffery A. Dobberpuhl for the Arcana Evolved Spell Treasury, which he co-authored. While you don’t need the Spell Treasury to use "The Lost," many of the spells referenced here come from that supplement. The scenario is suitable for a party of six 7th-level characters in any area of the Diamond Throne setting or any other Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved or d20 System fantasy campaign.

Available for download here: http://www.montecook.com/cgi-bin/page.cgi?mpress_Treas_enhan...

58388.name: The Giant's Map
58388.description:
From the publisher:

"The Giant’s Map" by Mike Mearls is a short adventure designed for use with Ruins of Intrigue from Malhavoc Press. It is written for a party of four 2nd-level adventurers. While it is set within the ruined city of Serathis, you can adapt it to any urban area of the Diamond Throne setting or any other Arcana Evolved or d20 System fantasy campaign.

This adventure has been designed in the manner of Ruins of Intrigue. Important NPCs and factions each have multiple backgrounds, motivations, and goals that you can use to sculpt the adventure to fit your tastes. Includes suggestions for miniatures appropriate for the NPCs.

Available for download here:
http://www.montecook.com/cgi-bin/page.cgi?mpress_Ruins_adv

58389.name: Runes of Revival
58389.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Free Three-Part Adventure for Monte Cook's Arcana Evolved

The cursed lands of Verdune threaten all life with a plague of undeath. Mage-priests say the ancient runes in the Pool of Revival may loosen the grim grip of death. Can you overcome the nightmares that stalk the land and complete the Rite of Revival to end the blight?

This adventure was originally presented as the three-round Arcana Evolved tournament "Runes of Revival” at Gen Con Indy 2005. It is now fleshed out as a free three-part web enhancement for the Diamond Throne, the default campaign setting for Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. The adventure series sets in motion events directly related to the return of the dragons, a central theme in Arcana Evolved.

Available for download here: http://www.montecook.com/cgi-bin/page.cgi?mpress_MCAE_Runeso...

58390.name: The Test of Time
58390.description:
From the publisher:

A Short Introductory Adventure for Monte Cook's Arcana Evolved

The Test of Time is a very short scenario designed to start off an Arcana Evolved campaign and bring all the player characters (PCs) together. It is designed for 1st-level characters who do not know each other and just happen to be in the right place at the right time - or, perhaps, the wrong place at the wrong time.

The adventure springs from the dragons’ return as detailed in Arcana Evolved and includes new concepts introduced in that book, including the ritual warrior and the dracha race. It is likely to encompass a single session of your game (the first one, obviously) and offers a way for a group of characters to assemble and form bonds without resorting to such tactics as, "You all meet in a tavern and are hired to...”

Available for download here: http://www.montecook.com/cgi-bin/page.cgi?mpress_MCAE_introa...

58391.name: Mandua
58391.description:
Mandua is an asymmetrical abstract strategy game, played on a square board with 25 spaces plus an aditional space at the middle of each side for a total of 29 spaces. One player plays the 4 tigers, the other one the 25 hunters. Tigers are on the board from the beginning and moving one space orthogonally, while hunters are first placed on the board one by one until all hunters are on the board. Then these also move in the same way.
Tigers now can capture hunters by jumping over one hunter and land on a free space behind it or move (not jump!) between two hunters and remove both of them. If a jump opens an occasion for another jump, this is done in the same move, and so on. The tigers are forced to capture as many hunters as possible, and the tigers` player has to tell before his move, how many total hunters he will capture in his move.
The only way hunters can capture tigers is a wrong move by the tigers` player. This is, when the tigers move in a way that they are only capturing less hunters than possible, if made a "perfect" move. The tiger which is doing the "wrong" move, is captured.
Hunters win, if tigers are all captured or immobilized. There are two more special situations, both "stalemates", but wins for the hunters: 1. If hunters are immobile (Mandua stalemate) or 2. if they are even sacrificed with the effect of immobilizing the remaining hunters.
Tigers win, if all hunters are captured.
This game was invented by two Germans living in Indonesia and is derived from the tactics of ancient Indian tiger-hunting.

58392.description: The Lycèe Trading Card Game is a Japanese collectible card game developed by Silver Blitz and published by Broccoli. It features characters from a number of licensed properties, mostly Japanese visual novel games. It has a strong moe/bishoujo aesthetic. Lycée is a French word roughly meaning 'high school.' The object of the game is to get one's opponent's sixty card deck down to zero, which is mostly done by attacking with character cards.
58392.name: Lycèe Trading Card Game

58393.name: Jig Jag Mic Mac
58393.description:
From the box description:

JIG JAG asks everyone to go a little nuts! It's the type of "let you hair down" game that's just as fun for kids and parents. How would you like to show your bellybutton to everyone? Or walk around like an ancient Egyptian until your next turn? Or smell the foot of the player on your right? Well, that's exactly what you'll have to do if you hope to build your jigsaw puzzle first!

Players race to complete puzzles by performing stunts.

58394.name: 1x1 Bingo
58394.description: Players lay out 16 tiles with numbers each. Then they take turns rolling 2d12. The numbers have to be multiplied to find out which number is "called". Called numbers can be covered by chips until a player has covered four in a row and is the winner.

58396.name: 20000 Mijlen onder zee
58396.description:
This game is build around the 3D of a submarine that can be manipulated in three ways. You can navigate it by turning it 45 or 90 degrees or adjust it's diving level by playing the corresponding action card. Subsequently you may retrieve the treasure token that is lying on the destination square.

Treasure tokens are placed in a personal 3x3 scoring grid. After each of three rounds the collected tokens are scored horizontaly. At the end of the game each column is also scored vertically.

58397.name: Lootin' Wizards: Character Marker Pack
58397.description: A Special release of cards and stands exclusively through The Game Crafter that adds standing character markers to match of the original 9 Wizards plus more. New exclusive cards to add to your Loot deck. Extra Map and Action Key cards to help you at the table. And a sneak peek at the first full expansion through the inclusion of the 10th Wizard, Alchemist Art. This mini-expansion adds a little more style and fun to the basic game.

58398.name: Black Widows
58398.description:
Subtitle: A game about super-spies, broken hearts, and sweet revenge

Publisher's description:

There is a man, the world's greatest super-spy, named Cobalt Gunn. Tall, dark, and handsome, he travels the globe doing super-spy things. If it's an English-speaking country, he's probably worked for it, stealing technology, learning secrets, shooting bad guys, and sleeping with exotic beauties. Wicked, deadly exotic beauties that he so casually left behind without even as much as a convenient lie to at least show he cared; not even so much as a well, that was nice, but I've got to go out and save the world early this morning and I'll call you later.

That son of a bitch.

In Black Widows, this incredibly short yet awesome RPG, you play the ex-girlfriends of Cobalt Gunn, a super-spy. Your mission: bring him to his knees.

58399.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Vol 2, Issue 1)
rpgissuearticle: Our Only Fear is Fear Istelf
58399.description:
Space Gamer #1 - September/October 1992
subtitled The Magazine of Free-Style Role-Play

Cover by Todd Pickens

Featured Game: Battle Born

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58400.description: Soccer Sonic is a 30-minute, 2 to 10 player fast pace card game play in team of two. In the game, each player takes a turn to maneuver and power kick towards the goal. When the ball finally enters the score zone, offense player plays a Kick/Block (KB) card with a matching direction to score. Defense then may play another KB card with matching direction to block. Both teams continue to kick and block until (1) offense team scores, (2) defense team plays a foul card, or (3) defense team blocks successfully and begins to maneuver towards their goal. After number of deck is depleted, the game ends, and the team with highest score wins. If it is a tie, another deck will be used for overtime, and if it is still a tie, the game ends with a draw.
58400.name: Soccer Sonic
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 98 - Q&A with Ta-Te Wu - Designer of Tien Zi Que and The Battle of Red Cliffs

58401.name: The Great Jungle Adventure
58401.description:
From the box: Race to rescue your stranded friend on the Island of Nowhere. Journey through the jungle: explore uncharted territory, collect exotic jewels, and create passwords to blaze your trail. You win if you are the first explorer to reach the Island of Nowhere.

Invented by a kid for kids! (7 yr old Mary Carville)
