58413.name: Chris Wheeler Role-Playing Conography
58413.description:
From the back of the book:

Chris Wheeler

18th September 1968 - 26th July 2009

'ROLE-PLAYING CONOGRAPHY'

This book has been complied to celebrate the creative role-playing life of Chris Wheeler. It contains a list of his known games run at conventions and home campaigns since he started writing for cons in 1989.

There have been many contributions for his friends who co-wrote with Chris or just enjoyed playing in one of his games over the years.

Throughout this book you will read a wide range of anecdotes and memories of events that surrounded his game or a convention as remembered by friends. Of course some references may seem esoteric to the reader, but it is hoped that in a small way it provides a sense of how Chris profoundly inspired fellow gamers.

Chris Wheeler was not only a prolific game designer but also an amazing story-teller who always ran outstanding campaigns for his friends.

58414.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 26 - Sep 2005)
rpgissuearticle: A Field Guide to the Creatures of the Hyborian Age
He Was Here a Moment Ago!
58414.description:
Issue 26 of Signs & Portents Roleplayer marks the separation of S&P into two free online PDFs, "Signs & Portents Roleplayer" and "Signs & Portents Wargamer".

In this issue ("Roleplayer"):


Masters of Deceit


A wretched collection of scum and villainy recruited from the dregs of society. Lies and deception can be vital survival traits to those that live in the gutter. An extensive collection of evil new Prestige Classes for your fantasy games!


A Field Guide to the Creatures of the Hyborian Age


The first part of a massive field guide to the creatures that inhabit Conan’s Hyboria, this article takes an extremely detailed look at the vicious, degenerate beings known as Man-Apes, carnivorous fiends that haunt the jungles and mountains of Hyboria.


He Was Here a Moment Ago!


In a welcome return for Gaming Symposium, we take a look at one of the questions that has bedevilled roleplayers since the dawn of creation (well, the late nineteen seventies) - how to deal with a character when his player can’t make it to this week’s session...


The Psyker’s Guide to Brit-Cit


In this unholy fusion of The Rookie’s Guide to Brit-Cit and The Rookie’s Guide to Psi Talent, you’ll be able to find details of all aspects of psi talents in Brit-Cit, including a new Judge character class, a couple of prestige classes and a somewhat familiar London monster, famous for his leaping abilities...


The Red Credit Crew


The Babylon 5 station holds a wide diversity of beings from all over the cosmos. Presidents and emperors can be spotted alongside the lowliest lurker. The Downbelow section of the station holds a surprising diversity of criminal elements along with the detritus of society. The infamous Red Credit Crew is a syndicate formed from this collection of dregs...


Ice Station Zebra 24


This month’s scenario is our first article for the new Starship Troopers Roleplaying Game. A squad of Mobile Infantry are given the seemingly simple task of checking in at a base - but find that the bugs got there first...

58415.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 31 - Mar 2006)
rpgissuearticle: The Fear Files: The Eel Witch
58415.description:
In this issue:


The Quartermaster’s Stores


Listen up, Apes! All Mobile Infantry troopers are recommended to keep abreast of the latest developments in hardware and killware in the war against the Bugs. SICON has authorised this technical update - move zig, trooper! Service guarantees citizenship!


The Savage


The latest in our occasional series of Power Classes, this massive article details everything you’ll ever need to know about gaining power from consuming parts of your defeated opponents! Featuring a whole host of new spells and abilities, your foes won’t know what hit them after they encounter the Savage!


Beyond Flesh


Life in the grim future of OGL Cybernet is nasty, brutal and, usually, short in the extreme. However, some hackers and mercs have discovered ways for their consciousness to survive on the Web, even if their meat body dies. Beware the Ghost in the Machine...


The Fear Files: The Eel Witch


Another article detailing the weird inhabitants of Morgan ‘Morgue’ Davie’s imagination, this time detailing the malevolent eel witch. Your OGL Horror characters won’t feel safe to sleep after this dark entity begins to invade their dreams...


Games Mastering Today


Gaming Symposium this month takes a look at a few ways of finding more time to roleplay and offers a few tips on alternative playing and Games Mastering styles.


Murder on the Megaways


The second and final part of this massive Judge Dredd scenario - can your Players survive the terrible puns long enough to investigate the murder? Now with MORE silly names and added outrageous pirates voices! Harrrr!

58416.name: Last Stand at Kirrinbahr
58416.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Inspired by the "Fighting Fantasy" series, "Last Stand at Kirrinbahr" is a solo fantasy role playing game book where you take on the role of the hero and play your part in deciding the final outcome. As well as the scenario, the game book includes full rules, maps and character sheets - all you need are two six-sided dice and a pencil! "Last Stand at Kirrinbahr" features mapping and inventory management along with a plot line full of twists, turns and epic combat. Please note you need to set the maps aside to refer to at appropriate times in the adventure - try not to read them in advance if at all possible!

58417.description:
Contents

Leading Off

News & Notes
Convention Calendar

The Meat Of The Order
Hall Of Fame Profile: Rick Loomis
Featured Review: Cosmic Encounter

One-Page Review: Horror On The Orient Express
One-Page Review: Battlesystem Skirmishes

Hitting Cleanup

Roll Dem Bones: Simple Justice, Part I
Capsule Reviews

User commentary

The capsule reviews touch on several other RPGs for a paragraph or two. All in all, despite covering the whole industry, there's a lot of RPG review material here -- more so than most magazines of the era.

58418.name: Gary Gygax's Insidiae
58418.description:
Subtitle: The Brainstomers Guide to Adventure Writing


From the back of the book:

Adventure scenarios are an indispensable part of all role playing games. Gary Gygax's Insidiae: The Brainstormers Guide to Adventure Writing covers five vitally important aspects of game adventure design: back story, antagonists, motive, locale and plot. Each chapter builds upon the details of the last, teaching the hallmarks of good game mastering. Working through the guide will aid game masters in creating adventures for any role playing game; provide an array of ideas, character types, backgrounds, places of encounter and danger, and plot devices needed to propel characters deeper into the story.

Just a sampling of the introdution: "Weaving together multiple events leading to gratifying conclusions, while maintaining for the players a sense of actual danger without the threat of certain doom, and the capacity to use or disregard rules when appropriate are the hallmarks of good game mastering. Adventures must not "lead by the nose", dragging characters lock-step through a clunky, linear plot. And resolution should allow for continuance; the promise of greater glory and danger in an ongoing campaign.

Insidiae breaks new ground for game designers, professional or amateur, writers or anyone who has ever wanted to unravel the mysteries good adventure or story writing!

58419.name: Gary Gygax's Living Fantasy
58419.description:
From the back of the book:

For the vigilant gamer or the driven world builder, Living Fantasy drives forward the host of information in the Gygaxian Fantasy Worlds series. Setting designers who master the knowledge with in this tome shall breathe magic into their creation. From vagabond to king, Living Fantasy details the everyday life of those who inhabit the towns , cities, and castles in a fantasy world, and contains supplementary rules for the d20 System.

Sound the note of world creation with Gary Gygax's Living Fantasy!

58420.name: Path of the Magi
58420.description:
From the back of the book:

Path of the Magi is the essential d20 System sourcebook on Wizards. Sean K. Reynolds, co-author of the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting, leads an all-star team of authors, including Mike McArtor, W. Jason Peck, and award-winning game designer Jeff Quick in exploration of the life of a wizard, from apprenticeship to iniation and beyond.

The magic-user's path begins with entrance into the University of the Magus, where the initiate learns spell craft, the guilds that master it, and their enemies. In addition to the completely detailed magic college, this book includes new feats based upon the signs of the Zodiac, new spells, equipment and magic items. DMs will find a treasure trove of information to create the ultimate role playing experience for players seeking to create heroes able to command the mysteries of magic.

boardgamehonor: 2010 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2010 JoTa Best Family Board Game Nominee
2011 Games Magazine Best New Advanced Strategy Game Winner
58421.description:
The players are builders in Ancient Egypt, competing to get the most fame building different monuments requested by the Pharaoh (the Sphinx, the Obelisk, the Temple, and the Pyramid).

The game lasts 5 turns. In each turn, the players place their pawns on the board, along the banks of the Nile, getting the advantages shown on each square. On the right bank there are fixed squares where the players may get workers, improve their mercantile capabilities, influence the floods (and thus the fertility of the fields) and reserve the right to build the monuments (that are built only after all the placements are done). On the left bank the players may take cards that are deployed randomly on the 10 squares at the start of each turn; some of these cards are kept until the end of the game (cultivable fields, stone quarries, deities granting special advantages), while others are discarded after the use and offer multiple immediate advantages.

In Egizia, the twist on the worker placement mechanic is that the players must place their pawns following the course of the Nile, moving northwards (from the top to the bottom of the board, that is seen from the Mediterranean Sea). In this way, each placement not only blocks the opponents from choosing the same square (except monuments, where multiple players are always allowed), but also forces the player to place his remaining pawns only on the squares below the one he just occupied (note that "pawns" are placed, since "workers" are one of the resources of the game, like grain and stones).

When the placement phase is over, the workers of the players must be fed with the grain produced in the fields. The production of each field is based on the floods of the Nile, so some fields may not give grain each turn. If a player has not enough grain for all his workers, he has to buy it with Victory Points (the ratio is better for players with improved mercantile capabilities, recorded on a specific track on the board).

After that, stones are received from the owned quarries and used to build the monuments (if the right to do was reserved earlier) along with the workers.

When the game ends, the points scored during the game (mainly building the monuments) are added to the bonuses obtained fulfilling certain conditions on the Sphinx cards. Whoever has the highest total is the winner.

Online Play


Yucata (turn-based)

58422.name: The Horror Beneath
58422.description:
From the back of the book:

In the Caves Everyone Can Hear You Scream!

Something sinister is happening in the village of Scarborough, and you've been hired to find out what. But what you'll find is even worse than you can imagine.

Are you up to the challenge?

"The Horror Beneath" is a d20 System fantasy adventure for levels 3-5. It is a complete adventure for 4-6 players. It includes everything needed to play. It is set in the World of Vallkan, and includes a preview of "Black Powder Gods", the next book set in this world.

58423.description:
From the web
"If you know the enemy and know yourself, your victory will not stand in doubt; if you know Heaven and know Earth, you may make your victory complete" (Sun Tzu, The Art of War). Empires of the Dragon, the new companion book for Field of Glory, reveals the secrets of the armies of Asia, from the samurai of Japan and the forces of the Qin to the elephant hordes of India and Thailand. With historical overviews, maps and artwork, and details for hundreds of new troop types, generals now have everything they need to know to command or crush the empires of the Far East.

58424.name: Changeover:  The Metric Game
58424.description:
Quote from instruction booklet (1976): "America has finally made the commitment to change its weights and measurement system from the Anglo-American system, which we now use, to the metric system."

Contents (from box lid):
1 instruction sheet
1 reference booklet
50 playing cards
9 game boards
60 miniature metric rulers

Gameplay: One person is selected to be the caller, and takes charge of the deck of cards. The rest of the players get different game boards depicting 9 objects or people and corresponding US measurements such as "7oz bottle of soda". The caller reads off a metric measurement, and then players say if they believe they have the matching US measurement depicted on their card, they get to cover that picture with a miniature metric ruler. The first player to cover all of the pictures on their cards wins the game. If answers are disputed, players can refer to the reference book.

58425.name: Trama. El joc de l'any Cerdà
58425.description:
The players meet to plan their city. Each one looks for the welfare of the citizens but, at the same time, wants to reach his secret agenda goals.

In each turn the players vote for or against some city planning proposals or put forward a new proposal. Once a proposal gets 13 votes the players determine whether the proposal is passed or rejected. But in the end it's the citizens (the citizenship cards in game terms) who decide which proposals among the passed ones are the best ones.

Components:
- 16 citizenship cards
- 49 voting cards
- 16 proposal cards
- 9 action cards
- 20 secret goal tokens

The game was published for the Any Cerdà (Cerdà year) celebration, which commemorates the great 19th century urban planner Ildefons Cerdà, specially known for his planning of Barcelona expansion in mid 19th century, the Eixample. (webpage: www.anycerda.org).

58426.name: The Skins Game
58426.description:
From back of box:

"Game Preview: Deal 4 cards face down to each player. 'Draw' cards from pile - exchange for lower values, play 9 holes. Avoid 'The 3 Putt Snake' while pursuing the bonus 'Bingo, Bango, Bungo.' Lo score wins big buckos!"

Cards include instruction cards, various bonus/bane cards, cards denoting money and numbered cards denoting various numbers of strokes.

58427.name: Tunnels & Trolls 5.5 Edition Boxed Set
58427.description:
User Summary

This box contains:

- 128-page Tunnels & Trolls Version 5.5 rulebook
- A 1996 errata sheet for solo adventures
- 8-page adventure Castle Ward
- 3 cardstock sheets with pre-generated characters


Publisher Blurb

Contains everything you’ll need to play, and more:

T&T Rulebook: easy to understand, filled with in-depth examples. Everything you’ll need to know to play T&T, including Combat, Magic, Weapons & Armor Charts, and Monsters, plus Elaborations, Weapons Glossary, Index, and Trollstone Caverns (an introductory game master adventure).

Buffalo Castle: A T&T adventure that you can play by yourself- because in place of a game master, the BOOK directs you through the adventure by offering written options. (Included in the rulebook)

Castle Ward: a gamemaster adventure, easy for a new GM to moderate. A nearly deserted castle guards the entrance to a monster stronghold.

Player Character Pack: 10 T&T characters to get you started, all completely attributed and equipped.

Three six-sided dice (games sold outside the US may not contain dice).

Bloom well in prison-air.
It is only what is good in Man
That wastes and withers there.
Pale Anguish keeps the heavy gate
And the Warder in Despair."

58437.description:
From the publisher:

+ Over 200 pages of extensive history and character background set in the world of The GODSEND Agenda.

+ Four new alien races: The Angelos, Atlanteans, Chimerans, and Elohim.

+ An all-encompassing list of Super human abilities and powers to make your character truly extraordinary.

+ Clear and concise rules for creating gadgets and artifacts of legendary power.

+ A style sheet for life in the year 2010

+ Completely compatible with all D6 titles printed to date, making the game world infinitely expandable!

58439.name: The Enzyme Game
58439.description:
A Game that explores the production and use of commercial enzymes.

Every player is responsible of one type of enzyme production and find fot it optimal conditions and prize

The game is finished when all players have passed the
finish line. The player with the most money wins.

Contents:

Gameboard
A enzyme booklet containing inforamation data sheets on the enzymes and the names of organisms that produce the enzymes
A set of Spinners
d6 Die
Money
Coloured microcentrifuge tubes are used as counters to move round the board
A Set of pink "Production Chance Cards" for enzyme production.
A Set of blue "Utilisation Chance Cards" for enzyme utilisation.

Challenge, the magazine of science-fiction gaming, is published monthly.

Challenge, the magazine of science-fiction gaming, is published monthly.

58443.name: Galactic Challenge
58443.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Galactic adventurer Rogan Hayl has joined the Resistance to fight the evil Morione Domain. Now a sinister alien life-form, the Subverted, has stolen Rogan's spaceship, the Prosperogenisis, and made his friend Zygash a slave of the Domain.

From his home base on Silverlight, Rogan travels to the water world of Pallaj and the honeycomb caverns of the mining asteroid Dvaad, facing weird aliens, hostile robots, and the mysterious psychic magic call the Music of the Spheres.

ENDLESS QUEST Books are action-packed stories based on exciting role-playing games that allow you, the reader, to make the decisions that determine the adventure's outcome. Read them over and over to experience new paths of excitement!

ENDLESS QUEST Books -- You Control the Adventure

58445.name: Bigby's Curse
58445.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Bogby drank a botched potion of longevity and now lies helpless as the evil denizens of Iuz seek to turn him into a lich. Only you can reach Bigby in time to administer the antidote -- if you can find
the mage locked away in his enchanted tower, and if you get to him before the setting of the sun. Wondrous, and sometimes dangerous, surprises await you behind every door. But don't forget that Iuz wants to find the wizard, too, and you're getting in the way of his plans.

It's a race against time and the forces of evil. Are you up to the challenge? Can you cure Bigby's curse?

ENDLESS QUEST Books are action-packed stories based on exciting role-playing games that allow you, the reader, to make the decisions that determine the adventure's outcome. Read them over and over to experience new paths of excitement!

ENDLESS QUEST Books -- You Control The Adventure

58447.name: Orlanth is Dead!
rpgissuearticle: News from the Trader: Issaries News
58447.description:
From the publisher:

Orlanth is Dead!, begins the Sartar Campaign with an epic conflict against the Lunar Empire. Whitewall has fallen, and all across Dragon Pass the winds have stopped. As winter deepens and spring fails to come, the rebellion begins in southern Sartar at the supernatural struggle later known as the Battle of Iceland. Despite the epic scope of this Great Event, it is not just for the demigod types, but for any hero who might attain such status! Where will you be when the Hero Wars begin?

Also includes a timeline of the Sartar Campaign, secrets of Kallyr Starbrow and the many Argraths, a Clan Questionnaire, a magical keyword for Yelmalio, and Hero Wars statistics for eight great leaders of the rebellion.

Orlanth is Dead! is the second book of the Sartar Rising campaign. It builds upon the information provided in Barbarian Adventures, the first book of the Sartar Rising series.

58448.name: The 24-Hour War
58448.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Centuries after the Nuke War, a purified Earth has become a garden of delights, with fresh air, singing flowers, no taxes, carnivorous ivy, Cannibal Biker Librarians, and Worms!
Welcome to the 24th century.

Giant robot spiders are smashing their way across the continent to destroy the noble Scamish Kingdom of Ohio. And the only chance these medieval knights have against their mechanized foes is you, Jason Montgomery, a teenager from the 20th century, and your suit of powerarmor, H.O.B.A.R.T. Now you have mere hours to stop the greatest army of evil ever forged.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices and experience your own adventure!

Remember, only your choices can lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books!

58449.name: Roleplayer (Issue 20 - Jun 1990)
58449.description:

58450.name: Storm Tribe: The Cults of Sartar
58450.description:
From the publisher:

This is the companion volume to Thunder Rebels. It describes the minority cults and societies that are important to the Heortling culture and Orlanthi religion.

It highlights Humakt, Urox, Elmal, Issaries, other Lightbringers and many others; as well as the Orlanthi shamanic traditions. It includes long write ups for a few deities, and short forms for the rest to give affinities and sample feats. Myths about these gods and goddesses are also here, as well as articles on miscellaneous Orlanthi information such as arm wrestling, kite flying and where the Lunar regiments are headquartered and patrol. Finally, it has information on the other "not quite right" people that are in the world, like Ducks, Telmori, and the trollish tribes of Kitori and Torkani.
Scheduled for December.

58451.name: Roleplayer (Issue 19 - Apr 1990)
58451.description:

Interesting Times (Steve Jackson)
Short Notes
GURPS Q&A
Converting a Campaign to GURPS (Rich Ostorero)
New for GURPS

SJ Games Raided! (Steve Jackson)

58452.description: Armies of the Great Italian Wars, Valois-Hapsburg-Tudor Wars, Turkish Wars, Chinese and Japanese Wars, The Americas and of the Reformation
58452.name: DBR Army Lists Book 1

58454.name: Roleplayer (Issue 18 - Feb 1990)
58454.description:
In this issue:


On the Road Again (Steve Jackson)
Short Notes
Quick Learning Under Pressure (Ann Dupuis)
Inherent Magic as the Only Magic (Steffan O'Sullivan)
New for GURPS
The Combat Powerstone (Brett Slocum)
Errata

Building Character
Specters (Steffan O'Sullivan
Coming Attractions

58455.name: Thunder Rebels: Player's Book for Orlanthi Barbarians
rpgissuearticle: News from the Trader: Issaries News
58455.description:
From the publisher:

This is the book to familiarize players with the day to day life of a Heortling barbarian. It gives new information about their culture, new character generation professions, and almost fifty subcults of Orlanth and Ernalda to join. It also includes myths and maps to help adventure on the Divine Plane, including a map of Orlanth's own divine Storm Realm.

58456.description: Armies of the European Early Northern Wars, Thirty Years War and Great Rebellions and of The Moghul Conquest of India
58456.name: DBR Army Lists Book 2

58457.description: Armies of the Eastward Colonial Expansion and of the European Enlightenment
58457.name: DBR Army Lists Book 3

58458.name: Anaxial's Roster: Creatures of the Hero Wars
rpgissuearticle: Elurae: The Foxwomen of Dragon Pass
58458.description:
From the publisher:

A million kinds of beasts live on the continent of Genertela in Glorantha. They appear in all the stories of the world. Some are friends, many are foes, a few are magical harbingers, and others are just food. Horses, dogs, and cats are nearly ubiquitous, wolf packs and metal goats are foes, ravens and rattlesnakes can talk, and cattle and deer are the feasts of every story.

This book contains over 150 entries describing more than 300 animals, monsters, and other creatures, including game statistics, origin myths, and other pertinent facts. Fifty illustrations illuminate the text. Eleven additional stories animate the collection. These creatures of the Hero Wars are a part of a changing world, where men can become immortal. The old ways are over, and even some creatures can become gods.

58459.name: Roleplayer (Issue 15 - Aug 1989)
58459.description:
In this issue:


We Did It! (Steve Jackson)
Short Notes
GURPS Q&A
Writing Supers (Loyd Blankenship)
Weapons and Armor in GURPS Space (Mike Hurst)
A New Advantage: Contacts (Brian J. Underhill)
GURPS Wild Cards Preview (Mark Johnson)
Cavemen and Conquistadors (Kirk Tate)
New for GURPS
Talismans (Steffan O'Sullivan)
Conan Beyond Thunder River: From the Cutting-Room Floor (W. G. Armintrout)
Errata
Coming Attractions

58460.name: Masters of Luck and Death
58460.description:
From the publisher:

This book takes the hero band rules from HeroQuest and puts them into practice. Each of the twenty-seven hero bands has a purpose for being in the Dragon Pass area, where the Hero Wars will start. Most are drawn from one of the homelands featured in HeroQuest, thus allowing new players an immediate home for their heroes. Five additional sections give tips about how to play in a campaign oriented around a certain type of hero: fighters, healers, scholars, wanderers and adventurers (merchants, entertainers, etc.), and magicians.

This book has something for everyone: Donandar entertainers, draconic scholars, feuding healers, Imperial magicians, Geo's Inn, and the Slayers of Harrek. Old fans will recognize bands such as the Comet Seers, Sword Brothers, and the Temple of the Wooden Sword, old favorites given new life in this book. Old and new fans alike will enjoy the new information presented here on Dragon Pass, Glorantha, and their inhabitants.

58461.name: Star Warriors: Starfighter Combat in the Star Wars Universe
58461.description:
From the back of the box:

"Star Warriors puts you at the controls of the TIE fighters, X-Wings, and other starfighters from the Star Wars universe. You'll jink, roll, loop, angle deflectors, dodge lasers, and return fire - pushing your ship and yourself to the limit as you battle to decide the fate of the galaxy!

In Star Warriors, you'll find:

Data for TIE fighters, TIE interceptors, X-Wings, A-Wings - and every other major Star Wars starfighter!
Detailed by easy to learn rules for snap fire, overturns and other maneuvers - you'll sly starfighters the way Rebel pilots fly them in the movies!
Standard, Advanced, and Optional Rules - you pick the complexity!




Star Warriors can be played by itself or with Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game."

58462.name: Men of the Sea
58462.description:
From the publisher:

The oceans of Glorantha are terrifying but beautiful; awe-inspiring yet full of terrible dangers. Their mysterious depths pull at the inner being of humankind, yearning for them to return to the source of all life. Their waves and currents offer heroes adventure, glory, and plunder; an exciting life for some, a quick death for others.

Men of the Sea explores the seas, coasts, and islands of Glorantha through the eyes of sailor heroes. It introduces eight new homelands for heroes, describes the many different ways that sailors worship Dormal the Opener, explores life as a sailor, and provides full rules for applying the HeroQuest rules to sea-borne contests. Men of the Sea teaches players how to navigate their heroes across the wonderful, dangerous waters of Glorantha--brave or foolhardy, these sailors ply the seas in search of fame, fortune, and knowledge.

58463.name: Champions of the Reaching Moon
58463.description:
From the publisher:

The Lunar Empire is a vibrant and dynamic empire of numerous different peoples, leagues, associations and gatherings, and its heroes are shaped by their social interactions, from the intrigue and debauchery of Moonson's Court to the day-to-day jokes and negotiations of the bazaar.

This book is built around the Immanent Action Liberation, a mighty political alliance committed to spreading the Lunar Way abroad and strengthening its political role and religious voice at home. The leagues and organizations within this alliance range from conspiratorial cabals of schemers to rough-edged military units, from canny merchants to open-handed missionaries.

Thirteen of these organizations are detailed here, including the sword-dancing Cossacks of the Varzum Paragons, the dog-soldiers of the Turzah Hounders and the Lorelords of Ershkintu, with their dwarf-forged underground scoutship. Each is fully detailed, and comes with its own story seeds, adventure outlines and background information to allow it to be integrated into games set anywhere in Glorantha.

The book also contains fourteen narrator-characters working for, with or sometimes against the Association. They range from an honorable judge whose investigations may uncover the Association’s darkest secret, to a three-quarters mad duck assassin and a trading magnate with murderous ambitions. Each is fully detailed and again twinned with narrator’s advice and information to maximize their use to any game.

These organizations and individuals can be allies, enemies or patrons of the player-heroes. They also each illustrate something about the complexity of Imperial life and be used as they are or simply for inspiration as part of the backdrop for games in the Empire.

58464.name: Savage Star Wars
58464.description:
One of a few FREE Savage Worlds Star Wars conversions.

Info contained within was obtained from:

https://www.starwars.com/databank,
https://www.swrpgnetwork.com,
WotC RPG Sourcebooks,
Star Wars Essential Guides and Novels,
Online Star Wars Wikis,
and author's brain.

58465.name: Gathering Thunder
58465.description:
From the publisher:

The Lunar Empire has been defeated at the Battle of Iceland. Orlanth is free, and across Dragon Pass and the world the winds have been released. This is the time to strike, the time for heroes to raise the rest of the land against the Empire, begin quests that will take years to bear fruit, and finally to aid Kallyr as she returns a lost planet to the sky and upsets the plans of the Empire.

Gathering Thunder is the third book of the Sartar Rising campaign. It continues the epic struggle of the Heortlings against the Lunar Empire, building on the events and information provided in Barbarian Adventures and Orlanth is Dead!, the first two books of the series. Gathering Thunder includes several scenarios set in Dragon Pass, each a testing ground for heroes as they rise to become leaders in the rebellion.

58466.name: Farbenpoker
58466.description: There are 18 little poles, their tips are in six different colors. These are stuck into a special tray. A turn works like this: A player rolls three color dice and pulls out a stick. If the color matches one of the dice, he or she gets a chip and the game passes on to the next player who has to find a stick in one of the remaining two colors, etc. If a stick doesn't match any of the dice, a chip has to be paid to the bank, the stick is put into the tray (on the other of the two sides of it). A player who can pull out the stick matching the last die gets all chips from the bank. The sticks are then put back into the tray, on the side which currently has less sticks. The winner is the player with most chips at the end of the game.

58468.name: SAVAGE! Star Wars
58468.description:
This is one of a few FREE Savage Worlds Star Wars conversions.

From the back of the book:

This book contains:
Setting rules for Star Wars using the Savage Worlds System.
Rules for the The Force, Force Powers and Lightsaber combat.
Rules for Starships. New Dogfighting rules to better simulate the fast paced combat of Star Wars.
New Edges and Hindrances.
More than 20 species for player to choose from.

58469.name: Fress-Sack
58469.description: The game consists of a kind of hungry clown with a spring. A player presses down the head which will suck on before being released after about 10 seconds, jump up and come down again. Between those movements, there is a gap between head and rest of the figurine. Players try to use the opportunity to throw in plastic fries (the gap is only open for a very brief moment). The first player to get rid of his or her fries is the winner.

58470.description: This is one of the leaping frog games where you push a frog down which will then jump into a target. What sets this version apart from the crowd is that the target bowls can be assembled into towers in various ways, creating different difficulty levels.
58470.name: Frosch-Hüpf-Spiel

58471.description: Cooperative children's game. A fox is trying to escape to the woods with a goose as prey, the players try to prevent that. There are several "exits" where the fox can escape unless a certain minimum number of player pieces block them. Players can donate their rolls to other players. If a fox symbol is rolled, the fox moves forward. If the fox escapes, everyone loses, if they can prevent it, everyone wins.
58471.name: Fuchs du hast die Gans gestohlen

58472.name: Dragon Pass: A Gazetteer of Kerofinela
58472.description:
From the publisher:

Dragon Pass, Land of Thunder illustrates the marvels and wonders of heroic and mythic Kerofinela. Journey from deadly Snake-Pipe Hollow through the Bush Range past impossibly tall Kero Fin, to occupied Boldhome (capital of the Kingdom) and then south into legendary Heortland. Witness the wonders of ancient Kerofinela, birthplace of great Orlanth.

Dragon Pass, Land of Thunder is a supplemental book for the Sartar Rising campaign. It provides maps and information on all of the important places in the land. Many features are described that in the past were only names, and many new places are detailed as well. In addition to many smaller maps, the book comes with a large, full-color map of Sartar drawn by Wesley Quadros under the direction of Greg Stafford. It also includes a complete index, making it the ideal resource for use with other Issaries, Inc. books.

Dragon Pass, Land of Thunder is a must for any narrator running a Sartar campaign, and for any serious fan of Glorantha.

58473.name: Reino de las antillas
58473.description:
In the Kingdom of the West Indies (Antilles), six kings fight to maintain control over the islands that they rule. Each player builds, collects resources, trains military forces and uses all kinds of strategies to stay in power. However, no one has a clear certainty of doing so.

Each ruler seeks to become stronger, build faster, increase trade, seek alliances, infiltrate their opponents, take advantage of their flaws, take away the commerce routes that maintains them, sabotage them and seize their resources.

Every movement is carefully calculated.

In the Kingdom of the Antilles there are no friends, no one can let their guard down, they are all enemies, we must seize every opportunity and act promptly and wisely.

Spanish:

En el Reino de Las Antillas, seis soberanos sostienen una lucha sin cuartel para mantener el control de las isla donde cada uno gobierna. Construyen, acumulan recursos, concentran fuerzas militares y utilizan toda clase de estrategias para mantenerse en el poder. Ninguno tiene la clara certidumbre de lograrlo.

Todo el tiempo cada uno busca hacerse mas fuerte, construir mas rápido, comercia, buscar alianzas, romperlas infiltrar, aprovechar las fallas de los adversarios, eliminar las bases que los sostienen, bloquear sus puertas, sabotear, apoderarse de sus recursos. Cada uno de sus movimientos esta cuidadosamente calculado.

En el Reino de las Antillas no hay amigos, nadie puede bajar la guardia, todos son adversarios, hay que aprovechar todas las oportunidades y actuar con prontitud e inteligencia.

58474.name: Globulus Cusani
58474.description: This game is played on a large mat (1 square meter). Players roll a special piece over this mat, trying to score points. The piece is a ball with a dent, so it rolls irregularly and can topple over, causing it to stop. There are several variants how the scoring works, such as getting closest to the center, scoring most points (the points are printed on rings on the map), etc.

58475.name: HeroQuest Voices
58475.description:
From the publisher's website:

Now Glorantha has come to a new generation of players with the release of HeroQuest. To accompany the launch, Issaries, Inc., is bringing out a range of game aids. The most substantial of these is HeroQuest Voices, a free PDF book containing introductory narratives for all ten homelands described in the rules, as well as for seven other peoples and races. This 64-page book uses the same format and double-page spreads as HeroQuest and other recent releases from Issaries, Inc., and contains more than two dozen illustrations.

Although some of these narratives have appeared before, they have been updated to reflect development of the world over the last fifteen years. Additionally, project coordinator Nick Brooke has assembled many new pieces written by some of today's key Gloranthan authors, including Greg Stafford, David Dunham (co-creator of the King of Dragon Pass computer game), and Mark Galeotti. The narratives are illustrated by a variety of artists, both old and new.

58476.name: Matemaatiline Doomino
58476.description: Mathematical domino. There are unfinished mathematical operations on both sides of wooden domino-tiles like "..-5=5" & "..+25=30". Players must continue the next operation correctly. Winner is the player who plays his last tile.

58477.name: The Savage Sword of Conan
58477.description:
FREE Hyborian races, arms, armor and sorceries for the Savage Worlds setting.

This book even includes an adventure.

58478.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 140 - Jun 2008)
rpgissuearticle: "Making Nowhere Somewhere...": Part Two - Building Construction
Back Room at the Games Pit
Disks of Wondrous Power: Old School, Old Friends, and Sort-Of Old Friends
A Gamer's Rant on the Movies
Lookin' at Comics: Smith, Zinn, the NY Comicon and Historic Comics
Summon Web Scryer: Take Your Kids to Wondrous Worlds of Gaming
Under the Hood: Aces & Eights - Rustlers & Townsfolk
58478.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #140
June 2008

On the Road Again

Cover art by Jolly R. Blackburn.

58479.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 139 - May 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Disks of Wondrous Power: A Lost Empire Lost
Gamemasters' Workshop: Exploring Magical Themes in a Non-Magic Setting
A Gamer's Rant on the Movies
Lookin' at Comics: To Read and Buy in L.A.
Tales of Tellene: Slayer's Brotherhood of Bet Bireli
58479.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #139
May 2008

Dr. Derangelove

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

58480.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 138 - Apr 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Disks of Wondrous Power: My Duty to Call Out Bad Design
Dungeons: Ready to Occupy - The Secret Lair of Captain Scargill
Gamemasters' Workshop: DIY Game Master Screens
A Gamer's Rant on the Movies
A Hacker's Guide to Garweeze Wurld
How Much is that Dalek in the Window?
Lookin' at Comics: The Sword, Simon and Scud Returns!
Summon Web Scryer: Ahoy Matey! Pirates Storm the Web
58480.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #138
April 2008

The Game Goes On!!

Cover art by Brendon Fraim and Brian Fraim.

58482.name: InTERRORgation
58482.description:
From the publisher:

Ms. Rush's latest game for The Brewery is InTERRORgation: A Little Game about Big Questions.

Movie aficionados and crime show fans understand this: the Interrogation is one of the greatest tropes in drama. Notable movies with interrogations are Usual Suspects, Payback, Marathon Man and just about any Hitchcock film. When on television, they can be seen in the Prisoner, Columbo, nearly every episode of Law and Order, and just about any other crime drama. In these and other media, the forms of interrogation are familiar, such as the classic scene (of late-night, hard-boiled fame) including a table, a chair, an overhead light bulb, and cigarettes.

InTERRORgation contains rules and ideas for role playing sessions designed to unnerve players as they play the roles of suspects. The players use interrogation scenes and flashbacks to determine the past as they struggle through the present.

InTERRORgation is a "shot," a small game with the rules you need to play and all the nonsense stripped away.

InTERRORgation comes in an unique format. It's difficult to describe -- you just have to see it to believe it. Think manilla envelopes, torn and forgotten documents you find in waste bins... you get the picture.

58483.name: Savage Mushroom Kingdom
58483.description:
This is a FREE Adaptation of The Mushroom Kingdom from the Super Mario Brother's series.

From the Author's Intro:

We all know Mario. Whether we played the original 8-bit NES ourselves or watched older brothers hog all the play time (even though Mom and Dad said “Share!”) we are all familiar with the efforts of the heroic plumber. This is a setting devoted to all those times we yanked the game pack out of the machine to blow on it, all the times the Hammer Brothers knocked us off in World 3, and every time you leaned to the right in your chair in the hopes that Mario might just jump a little further if you helped.

58484.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 137 - Mar 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Close Encounters of the Random Kind
Disks of Wondrous Power: Fantasy Quake Wars
Dungeons: Ready to Occupy - The Lizard Lament
Gamemasters' Workshop: A Character Driven Game - Getting off the Train
Gamemasters' Workshop: It's the Economy Stupid
A Gamer's Rant on the Movies
A Hacker's Guide to Garweeze Wurld
Lookin' at Comics: Gift Certificate Mayhem!
Summon Web Scryer: Zombie Fighting on the Web
W.W.A.G.D. What Would a Gamer Do?
58484.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #137
March 2008

Behind the Hard8 Ball

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

58485.name: Dragon (Issue 317 - Mar 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Body of Knowledge - Feeling it in the Bones
Countdown to Eberron - Races of the New World
Faiths of Faerun - Battleguard of Tempus
Faiths of Faerun - Holy Strategies of the Red Knight
The Play's the Thing - Running a non-iconic party, part 1
Truenames and Fetishes  - The Power and the Peril
Under Command - Out of Thin Air
Up on a Soapbox - The End of Muryland's Mayhem
Urban Druids - Secret Voice of the City
58485.description:
It's a Whole New Game - Exotic Heroes!

Vol. XXVII, No. 10
Cover art by Michael Phillippi

58486.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Special #1 - Aug 2008)
58486.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table: KODT Special #1
August 2008

Last Man Standing

Cover art by Jolly R. Blackburn.

Publishers Blurb:

A new live action game has hit Muncie - Urban Assassin: Stalking the Most Dangerous Game in the Concrete Jungle. Armed with paintball guns, players are pitted against players as they hunt each other down. The goal? To be the last man standing.

This original self-contained story has it all - intrigue, betrayal, and laughs. From Weird Pete’s Back Room to the Public Library, to the Open Gaming Room at GaryCon itself - nowhere is safe.

Don’t turn your back.
Don’t trust your friend.
And save the LAST paint ball for yourself.

58487.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Origins '04 Special - Jun 2004)
58487.description:
A special issue released at Origins 2004.

Cover by Brendon Fraim and Brian Fraim

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58488.name: FASA and GameLords Licensed Traveller
58488.description:
Note: As this is a compilation of thirty separate items in PDF form on a single CD-ROM credits are only for the compilation. Please see individual items as linked in the descriptions below for credits on these items.

From the back of the CD:

On this CD-ROM: Part I of the Apocrypha for Classic Traveller -The original texts of the FASA and GameLords supplements and adventures created "For Use With Traveller." Includes:


From FASA (10 deck plan sets and 9 adventures)

Deck Plan Sets (more than 33 ships and small craft): Adventure Class Ships, Volume 1 and 2, Merchant Class Ships (6 ships), Aslan Mercenary Ships, Hotel Complex, ISCV: King Richard, ISCV: Leander, ISPMV: Fenris (and Valkyrie), ISPMV: Tethys, ZISMV: Vlezhdatl.

Adventures: Action Aboard, Ordeal by Eshaar, Rescue On Galatea, the Sky Raiders Trilogy, The Stazhlekh Report, The Harrensa Project, Uragyad'n of the Seven Pillars.


From GameLords (11 adventures and supplements)

Adventures: Lee's Guide to Interstellar Adventure, Startown Liberty, Wanted: Adventurers.

Enviroments: The Desert Environment and Duneraiders, The Mountain Environment and Ascent to Anekthor, The Undersea Environment and The Drenslaar Quest.

Subsector Guides: A Pilot's Guide to the Drexilthar Subsector, A Pilot's Guide to the Caledon Subsector


Plus: The Official Guide to FASA Traveller and the Official Guide to GameLords Traveller - each an overview of the licensed Classic Traveller materials produced under license.

58489.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 34 - Jun 2006)
58489.description:
In this issue:


Of Steam and Other Technologies


The first instalment of a huge article detailing the world of OGL Steampunk. The world has known a great deal of technological advances over the centuries - how might things have been different if the ways of magic had found their way into the minds of the world’s great scientists and engineers...?


Stygian Spells


Conan expert Vincent Darlage returns, bringing a few brief lessons in Stygian spellcraft to fox the minds of your Hyborian Age adventurers. Beware the dark way of the necromancer...


The Black Cross Mercenaries


Another in our series detailing the future of the human race in the Starship Troopers universe. This month, we take a look at SICON’s most human foe - the mysterious force known as the Black Cross...


Eruan Pathfinder


Travellers in the realm of Magnamund are often forced to cross vast areas, passing through all sorts of strange environments. One type of adventurer spends his entire life wandering in the woods and deserts, unseen by others and living in harmony with the land - the mysterious Eruan Pathfinder!


All About Charm Person


Morgan Davie emerges briefly from the untold horrors of his Fear Files to take a look at one of the simplest but often overlooked spells in a wizard’s spell book - the humble charm person trick...


The Cult of Bel-yog-thulu


It seems like it’s just another day for the Judges - a simple case of murder and inflatible mongooses let loose all over the City. However, this simple investigation soon takes a turn for the sinister in this month’s scenario for The Judge Dredd Roleplaying Game...

58490.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 35 - Aug 2006)
58490.description:
In this issue:


Priest of Ishar


Marco Conti presents a new hero for the Lone Wolf roleplaying game. Sustained by an unbreakable faith, they have the holy mission of guarding the peoples of the world from any threats Naar poses.


Drops And Drop Capsules


The Mobile Infantry have a particular way of deploying for battle. Find out now before you sign up with this in depth article explaining just what happens when the loading doors shut.


Of Steam and Other Technologies


The second instalment of this huge article detailing the world of OGL Steampunk. The world has known a great deal of technological advances over the centuries - this issue Alejandro Melchor switches his attentions to the occult.


Fear Files: Cat Demons


More from horror maestro Morgan Davie. If you ever looked down at the family moggy and got a strange look back this will put you off your sleep!


Scenarios of Shadizar


Everybody says there are 101 things to do in a big city, and Vincent Darlage went out and did them all in Shadizar. Look in here to find out what he got up to and then annoy your Games Master to put some into your Conan adventures.


A Raven In The Roost


To commemorate the release of RuneQuest we have this fantastic adventure from the pen of mongoose staff writer Bryan Steele. It looks like there’s trouble in the duck illage of Roost and the players are going to have to sort out out. You’re dealing with ducks, so you know RuneQuest is back!

58492.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Vol 2, Issue 4)
58492.description:
Space Gamer #4 - March/April 1993
subtitled The Magazine of Free-Style Role-Play

Cover by Susan Van Camp

Featured Game: Stuff O' Legends

User Comments:
This issue marked a turning point in the quality of the eight issue run by Better Games. The stock of both the cover and the pages was much heavier and the managing editor changed from Pat Mannion to Red Dog. It also marked the first issue not crediting Rahm & Hilmer as publishers.

Core of the issue is the Duo-Play game Stuff O' Legends. Not really an RPG, it is more of a board game.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58493.name: OGL Wild West
58493.description:
From the back of the book:

"This is a game about the American West. Some of the book is about how it was, and some is about how it is remembered. It is up to the players and Games Master to find their own version of the West, finding their own trail between truth and legend. If the players want a historically accurate game where miles are miles, events occur as they truly did, and death comes more often from disease than a bullet, then they will find the tools they need in this book. Alternatively, if the players want a game inspired by movies and dime novels, where the history is just a painted backdrop and heroes ride high in the saddle, then they too will find their desires catered for within.

The characters may be counted among those who build America, who drove the railroad across the continent and built the Western states. They may be soldiers who fight at the famous battles of the West, or adventurers who blaze the trails through the wilderness. They can be statesmen or scoundrels, outlaws or lawmen, the quick or the dead. They will either become part of the legend, or die in some godforsaken hot and dusty place and be forgotten."

58494.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 37 - Oct 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Mega-City One's Most Wanted: Judge Giant
The Support Fleet of the Anla'Shok
58494.description:
In this issue:


OGL Wild West: Wandering Stars


A complete history of the U.S. Marshals and a new vocation for your gunslingin' lawmen.


101 Character Backgrounds


Be more than a farm boy with a sword destined to become a king... be a king with a hoe destined to own a farm!


Starship Troopers: Codename: Armoured Fury, Part Two


The continuing saga of Thrower's Tigers.


Starship Troopers: The Heavy Weapons Specialist


A new area of cross-training for your Starship Troopers characters. Because sometimes, you just need to blow things up.


Babylon 5: The Support Fleet of the Anla'Shok


Part 2 of our three-part series covering the Legend of the Rangers movie. This month, we look at the lesser known spaceships seen in the film and examine their wider use by the Rangers.


Paranoia: Paranoid Paperwork


Some helpful forms to keep your Troubleshooters' lives efficient and treason-free!


Mega-City One's Most Wanted: Judge Giant


Statistics and a brief biography of one of Judge Dredd's staunchest allies.


RuneQuest: Lesser Known Fauna and Flora


Three unusual creatures and three useful plants ready to drop straight into your games of RuneQuest.


Conan: The Staff of Ibis


Search for artefacts of unearthly power, rescue your bodyweight in gold from ancient tombs, and cleave - or be cleaved by - mighty foes in this desert adventure.

58497.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 38 - Nov 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Babylon 5: The 2nd Edition Conversion Guide, part 2
Mega City One's Most Wanted: Judge Giant II
58497.description:
In this issue:


Babylon 5: Flight of the Redhelms


They came. They blew stuff up. They went away again. Here is one possible interpretation of the mysterious race from A View From the Gallery.


101 Mimic Disguises


Is it scenery? Or a seven hit-die aberration just waiting to attack you with an acidic pseudopod? We poke things with sticks and find out.


RuneQuest: Enchanted Items From the useful turncoat to the hazardous black vapours - a selection of oddments for your RuneQuest adventures.



Inside the Chainmail Bra


Fey Boss returns with her unique viewpoint on roleplaying.


Babylon 5: The 2nd Edition Conversion Guide, part 2


This month, Bryan Steele tackles the way the classes have changed between 1st and 2nd editions.


Mega-City One’s Most Wanted: Judge Giant II


A brief biography of Judge Giant, Jr. and statistics so he can ally with - or arrest - your player characters.


RuneQuest: Totally Random Characters


The preferred method of generating RuneQuest characters here at Mongoose Towers: roll dice until all your questions are answered.


Conan: Gladiators of Messantia


An overview of the workings of the arena of Messantia, designed to complement the information provided in Argos and Zingara. Sample gladiators, too!


Judge Dredd: The Accused A Judge Dredd investigation, short on combat but long on detective work and difficult moral decisions.

58498.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 39 - Dec 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Mega-City One's Most Wanted: Rico Dredd
58498.description:
In this issue:


The Village of T'Kinama


A village of predatory lizardfolk for your d20 games. Ideal for use with the Slayer's Guide to Lizardfolk.


Babylon 5: Techno-Mages, 2nd Edition


Everyone's favourite bald-headed dispensers of cryptic wisdom, updated for the new edition of the Babylon 5 roleplaying game.


RuneQuest: Rune Magic


A septet of handy runic spells from the pen of our RuneQuest regular Carl Walmsley.


Bloody Beasts


Six blood-soaked creatures to horrify your Player Characters with, from the crustacean crimson crab to the sorcerously sanguine walker in red.


Babylon 5: The Miri'Zha


The final, third part of our series of articles based on the Legend of the Rangers TV movie. Here we look at the guiding council of the Anla'shok.


Mega-City One's Most Wanted: Rico Dredd


A look at the original Rico Dredd, metal-faced ex-Judge and nemesis of Mega-City One's best-known lawman.


WARS: Armour


The first part of our serialisation of Soul and Steel, the unreleased WARS arms and equipment guide. This month, we cover ways to protect yourself from incoming fire.


Lone Wolf: The Corruption of Ikaya, part 1


The first part of an epic Lone Wolf adventure. This month, your Player Characters fight Giaks, visit a quaint fishing village, fight Giaks, sail the seas, and fight some more Giaks.

58499.description:
Space Gamer #5 - May/June 1993
subtitled The Magazine of Free-Style Role-Play

Cover by Todd Pickens

SGFG switched to Perfect binding for this and the remaining issues.

Featured Game: Guardians of Sol

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58500.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 41 - Feb 2007)
58500.description:
In this month's issue:


RuneQuest: Druids


Drawing in part from history and in part from fantasy, here are all the rules and background you need to insert druidic culture and pungent herbal remedies into your RuneQuest games.


OGL: d20 Cards


Give your OGL games that riverboat casino feel by replacing the ubiquitous d20 with a deck of cards. Also includes card-based feats, spells, and prestige classes.


WARS: Weapons, Part 2


'Stop thinking police and start thinking Playstation!' Rocket launchers, flamethrowers, gauss cannons too big for a man to lift and explosives placed, fired and thrown. Really big guns for WARS.


Conan: The Saami


A new race for your Conan characters. Inuits from the frozen north. Yes, even more frozen and even further north than Nordheim.


Babylon 5: Earth Alliance Special Forces, Part 1


The first installment of this two-part article looks at the people and the organisation of the various branches of EarthForce special forces. Includes background and prestige classes.


Starship Troopers: Codename Armoured Fury, Part 3


The long-awaited third and final part of our Starship Troopers fiction.


RuneQuest: A Recipe for Disaster


A short introductory scenario for RuneQuest featuring an odd ailment, killer bees, and mysterious pies.
